programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Alston House in Cumbria, where owners Michael and Carole Allchorne are brimming with confidence, but Yvonne Copeland and Gail Wells are less than impressed with the decor. The guests are impressed with chef Michael's breakfast, but the hosts are left reeling by the criticisms levelled at their hotel during the feedback session.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Scotia House in Harrogate, where host Marie Lock is hoping her obsessive cleaning regime will give her the edge in the competition. In the rooms, both Michael and Carole and Yvonne and Gail find the deluxe teddy bears freaky, and for Billy and Billy, things are a little on the cosy side. In the afternoon, Marie's keen to show off her moves and pits her guests against each other in a Northern Soul dance off.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Canberra Guest House in Blackpool for the third day of the competition, where host Yvonne Copeland, joined by her part-time helper Gail Wells, hopes her cheap and cheerful B&B will win over her guests. However, Marie finds what she thinks is urine and hair on the toilet seat in her room, and a lack of wi-fi means Billy Junior has to put his business on hold. Yvonne takes her competitors to a local reptile house, but serious divisions unfold within the group, and later, tensions rise again at dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Crown and Kitchen in East Linton, Scotland, owned by father and son Billy and Billy Jr Robertson, who see themselves as the jokers of the pack. Yvonne and Gail leave no mattress unturned in their room inspection, although Michael and Carole are impressed. Later, Yvonne makes quite a splash when the hosts organise an assault course for their guests, but slow service during breakfast leaves the B&Bers disappointed - especially when Billy Jr is at a loss to explain what the problem was.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. Things are tense from the start as Carole and Michael from Alston House challenge Marie on her comments. Next, Marie from Scotia House wants to set the record straight with allegations of tit-for-tat scoring. The group members proceed to thrash out their differences before the week's winners are revealed.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr is joined by First Dates love ambassador Fred Sirieix, food critic Jay Rayner, deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander to put fish pie, lager and smoked bacon to the test. Plus, the quick-fire public taste test this time is for garlic bread.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wiederhorn, CEO of Los Angeles-based fast food restaurant Fatburger, goes incognito among his employees in order to learn more about his business that has evolved from a late-night hangout for musicians in the 1950s to an international success story.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steve Greenbaum goes undercover among the workforce of his company PostNet, which offers design, printing and shipping services to small businesses. Posing as a failed motorcycle shop owner, he tries to find out how his staff are responding to firms that have been hit by the global recession.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jim Rogers, chairman and CEO of Kampgrounds of America, goes undercover within his own company to discover whether his employees share his boy-scout philosophy. However, Jim's wife Sandy fears his naturally outgoing and cheerful nature could undo his cover story as a recently unemployed reality show contestant.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: John Wilson, the President and Chief Operating Officer of Rollins Incorporated - the parent company of eight pest-control firms including flagship brand Orkin - goes undercover. He poses as a contestant on a reality TV competition who is trying to win money for his own business, and works alongside his employees to make sure the organisation is heading for another century of keeping homes rodent-free.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: President of Moe's Southwest Grill, Paul Damico, goes undercover to check the standards he values are still being met. The company is one of the world's fastest growing restaurant chains with 10,000 employees and Paul wants to look for opportunities to assist his staff in a similar way to how his family were helped by his father's bosses during his childhood.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for the Grasshopper Also in Carlstadt, New Jersey, a family-owned Irish restaurant. There, he lends a helping hand to Mitch Sandler, who has been struggling to live up to the expectations of his father-in-law since he invested heavily in the business. The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Boston to help change the fortunes of a failing Italian restaurant run by two brothers. The eatery's decline began when one of the pair started embezzling money to fund his prescription drug addiction, and things only got worse when the he was sentenced to four years in prison. With the time now served, he has returned, but must first regain his brother's trust before he can save their business.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Two-year-old Labrador Ira is fitted with a bionic spine, while anxious owner Rob brings in eight-year-old French bulldog Tom with a long list of chronic ailments. Matt and Rebecca arrive at the clinic with their three-year-old cat Marley, who may need to have a leg amputated.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and David O'Doherty compete against Jon Richardson and Natasia Demetriou. John Kearns joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 80-year-old patient is admitted suffering from pain in her chest, arm and jaw, and consultant Sarah is concerned that Joan's heart is struggling and requests an urgent blood test and heart. Meanwhile a 26-year-old woman who fell and hit her head during a hen party in Ibiza complains about headaches, dizziness and vomiting, with doctors fearing she may have caused serious damage.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The dads are under the spotlight at Liverpool Women's Hospital as three very different men prepare for fatherhood. Midwife Kirsty looks after Rebecca and Jack, a soldier who's more confident about going into battle than he is about changing nappies. Mum Billie arrives with her ex-partner Nathan, and although they're apart, they hope they can raise their child together. Cameras also follow John, who has always wanted to be a dad. He hopes some of his broodiness will rub off on girlfriend Natalie.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Kevin and Natalie discover their beloved six-year-old German shepherd has a tumour. In desperation, they turn to Noel Fitzpatrick in the hope he can find a way to prolong Otto's life until their wedding day. The team also sees Jane, Simon and their Rottweiler puppy Elvis, who is having trouble walking, and seven-week-old Pomeranian Gucci, brought in with a broken paw by Amber and her two children after only 48 hours in her new home.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Two-year-old Labrador Ira is fitted with a bionic spine, while anxious owner Rob brings in eight-year-old French bulldog Tom with a long list of chronic ailments. Matt and Rebecca arrive at the clinic with their three-year-old cat Marley, who may need to have a leg amputated.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Holiday Resort
programme.desc: Cameras monitor life at the all-inclusive Holiday World Resort in Malaga on Spain's Costa del Sol to take a warm-hearted look at what Britons get up in the sun and what it takes to keep them happy. Those featured include the Lloyd family from Northampton, including 12-year-old Danny whose singing and dancing proves a hit at the aquafit class. The Wades from Southend-on-Sea, Essex, are hoping to bond via the resort's all-inclusive entertainment - provided the children stop bickering, while James and Leanne from Preston battle the crowds during the morning stampede for the pool.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Debbie and Tony Parkes have been married for 40 years, and are ready for a new chapter in their lives. With retirement around the corner, they've set their hearts on a holiday home in Albufeira on Portugal's Algarve with a budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies shows a number of properties to Robin and Susan Loxton from Suffolk, who want to buy a holiday home around the area of Mijas, their favourite part of southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows sun-worshippers Carol and Junior Smith from Middlesex five properties on Spain's popular Mar Menor in the hope one will meet their approval.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps mother and daughter Rhona Brennan and Nina find the perfect family holiday home that could also work as a B&B in the French region of Limousin.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: After 30 years of marriage and a life dedicated to their family, Simon and Mary Loyne feel the time has arrived to focus on themselves. They have sold their Cheshire home and cannot wait to move to Spain's Costa Almeria. Danni Menzies shows them five fabulous properties for their budget of £100,000, but do they go for a townhouse with a man cave Simon really wants or an apartment close to the beach, in Mary's perfect location?.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Officers chase £4,500 in court fees in North Wales after a property deal turned sour, and in Birmingham the agents try to collect over £3,500 from a single mum who defaulted on loan repayments. Elsewhere in Worcestershire, the enforcement agents try to recover more than £10,000 from a shop-keeper for fraudulently keeping a deposit during a property sale.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In Staffordshire agents try to collect nearly £2,500 in unpaid parking fines, while officers Matt and Garry head to the West Midlands to recover £4,500 owed from a debtor to his former girlfriend. Elsewhere, agents travel to south east London looking to collect £3,000 owed by a taxi company.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In South East London, officers Gary and Cona chase a debt of nearly £50,000 in unpaid rent, leading to a feisty confrontation with the debtor. Elsewhere, agents Gary and Paul try to recover over £2,000 owed by a teenager to a local garage in Kent, and officers Max and Paul head to South West London on the trail of a film producer who owes £8,000 to financial advisers.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary series giving an insight into the world of debt collection from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments. Brian and Graham have been warned to expect trouble as they evict some tenants from a south London flat, one of whom has a reputation for violence. Everything goes smoothly until the enforcement agents make a shocking discovery in a child's bedroom. Paul and Steve head to Slough to collect wages owed to a freelance worker, but the debtor is less than happy to find the high-court enforcement officers on his doorstep and things get physical.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits and 40 Grand in Debt.
programme.desc: Documentary telling the stories of people struggling to live on state welfare, focusing on some who have found themselves in serious debt.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: And a Baby on the Way.
programme.desc: The documentary series meets three mothers trying to raise their children on benefits. Amy recently moved to the Isle of Wight with her partner to be close to his family, only to end up living alone with her two children. Single mum Natasha from Camberley is expecting her second child and struggles to get by, often missing meals so she can afford to feed her 16-month-old son, while Essex mum Becky receives £450 per month and enjoys a life beyond her means, typically spending £500 on her daughter at Christmas.(n)

programme.title: Named and Shamed: Greatest Celebrity Scandals
programme.desc: A rundown of the most salacious celebrity scandals to shock the worlds of pop, film, television and sport. This documentary relives some of the most stunning star slip-ups, with interviews from professional observers, and nostalgic archive footage. Among the mishaps revisited are Hugh Grant's ill-advised detour on Hollywood Boulevard and Cheryl's infamous bust-up in a nightclub toilet.(n)

programme.title: Divergent
programme.desc: A teenager grows up in a strictly ordered future society where people's lives are decided according to personality types. She discovers she does not fit into any of the existing categories, and must fight against a conspiracy to wipe out all those like her. Sci-fi adventure based on the book series by Veronica Roth, starring Shailene Woodley and Kate Winslet.(n)

Directed by Peter Sollett. Also stars Steve Carell, Michael Shannon, Josh Charles, Luke Grimes, Mary Birdsong and Gabriel Luna(n)

programme.title: Winter's Tale
programme.desc: In early-20th century New York, a thief falls for a dying heiress, but he is being pursued by a vengeful enemy(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Joe Darrow works as a doctor in the emergency room of Chicago Memorial Hospital. His wife, Emily Darrow, was last seen in a rainstorm in Venezuela, where she was on a retreat with the Red Cross offering humanitarian aid. She vanished in a bus accident. There were no survivors and her body was never found. That rich, green, exotic land is left behind as Joe is challenged to persevere through sad, rainy days back home. Joe promised Emily that if anything ever happened to her, he would visit her patients in the oncology ward. Strangely, the children seem to know him, and they say they've seen Emily in their near-death experiences. Joe starts to believe that his wife is using the near-death experiences of her terminal patients to communicate with him, through images the children report seeing in their dreams, and symbols they are inexplicably compelled to draw. While the children see Joe as a kindred spirit, the hospital staff worries about how these interactions are agitating them. At home, Joe begins finding other ethereal evidence of his wife's attempt to contact him from beyond the grave, some of it featuring the image of a dragonfly, which was the shape of the birthmark on her shoulder. His friends and a caring neighbor (Kathy Bates) worry that Joe is losing his marbles, especially as his quest becomes more frantic, putting his job in jeopardy(n)

programme.title: Doctor Detroit
programme.desc: Comedy starring Dan Aykroyd as a well-meaning college professor who finds himself unintentionally entangled with hookers and the local mafia(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: As they await eviction from a Miami hotel, four retired mobsters try to scare off the other residents by making them an offer they can't refuse. Burt Reynolds, Richard Dreyfuss. Donatelli: Dan Hedaya. Donato: Seymour Cassel. Det. Neal: Carrie-Anne Moss. Ferris: Jennifer Tilly. Directed by Michael Dinner(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Comedy about a failed actor turned drama teacher who, in a final and deluded attempt to make an impact, sets about creating a controversial and 'inspirational' sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Riotous campus comedy in which a lawyer unwittingly gives his thirty-something friends an opportunity to recapture their college years when he relocates to a local university. Having caught his wife cheating on him, the out-of-luck attorney finds his new house turning into a 24-hour party pad for a variety of misfit college students, middle-aged slackers and elderly retirees as he struggles to avoid being evicted by the new Dean of Students(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: Eddie Mannix is a Hollywood 'fixer', and is part of the upcoming production starring superstar actor Baird Whitlock(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: In this epic fantasy adventure, a young thief named Bek enlists the help of the powerful Egyptian god Horus to overthrow the vicious deity Set, who has seized control of the land. Bek's true love has been captured, forcing the mortal rebel to fight back in order to free her and the people of Egypt from Set's tyrannical rule(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: Taut drama about an ambitious young stockbroker who is seduced by money and power when he hooks up with a high-powered company trader. But he faces a crisis of conscience when he discovers the truth behind the trader's bid to buy up an airline for which his father is a union rep. Michael Douglas won an Oscar for Best Actor for his portrayal of Gordon Gekko - the personification of 80s greed(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Disgruntled Korean War veteran Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbour, a Hmong teenager who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession - a 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.title: The Omen
programme.desc: After his wife gives birth to a stillborn child, the American ambassador to Britain switches two kids in their hospital cribs. What he doesn't know is that little Damien is the Anti-Christ. Seminal 70s horror(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: A desperate mother seeks the help of a pair of priests, when her angelic daughter becomes possessed by a terrible demon. Horror(n)

programme.title: Trade
programme.desc: Adriana is a 13-year-old girl from Mexico City whose kidnapping by sex traffickers sets in motion a desperate mission by her 17-year-old brother, Jorge, to save her(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: In the Far East, Alex O'Connell, the son of famed mummy fighters Rick and Evy O'Connell, unearths the mummy of the first Emperor of Qin -- a shape-shifting entity cursed by a witch centuries ago(n)

programme.title: Sgt. Bilko
programme.desc: A conniving army sergeant pulls numerous cons while feuding with one of his former victims who attempts to get him kicked out of the service(n)

programme.title: Tron
programme.desc: Sci-fi thriller in which a young computer genius is sucked into a master computer system while trying to hack into it to prove that his ideas for video games are being stolen. He and his henchman, the electronic warrior Tron, face many trials and finally have to battle for their lives with the computer itself(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: In 1920s New York, gangsters rub shoulders with celebrities at Harlem's Cotton Club. A jazz musician falls for a mobster's moll and a black dancer pursues a mixed race chorus girl, but racial and legal divides keep them apart(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Hayden Christensen puts down his light saber to deliver a fine performance in this engrossing, fact-based tale of journalist Stephen Glass, whose up-and-coming career came to a screeching halt when it was discovered that he fabricated stories. Peter Sarsgaard, Chloe Sevigny, Rosario Dawson, Hank Azaria(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Eerie saga about a rare-book buyer who becomes a target of unknown forces when he's asked to find a volume about the Devil(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Set in the Depression of the '30s in southern United States, this drama portrays the remarkable relationship established between Paul Edgecomb (Tom Hanks), a prison guard on Death Row, and John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan), a hefty colored man sentenced to death for a brutal double homicide. As the days go by, and after some surprising experiences, Edgecomb begins to have doubts about Coffey's culpability. He is a naïve, apprehensive man with a supernatural gift. Based on a novel by Stephen King, this drama received four Oscar nominations(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalised when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: Hoosiers tells the true story of a group of underdogs who become champions. Set in the 1950s, Hoosiers is about a hard-luck, unemployed college basketball coach (Gene Hackman) who gets a chance to coach a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team. Facing resentment from the community and the team itself, Hackman manages to inspire his young athletes, leading them to the state championship with the help of the assistant coach (Dennis Hopper), who happens to be a recovering alcoholic(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: An exploration of human survival and the ability of fate to alter even the tidiest of lives with one major event, Cast Away tells the story of Chuck Noland (Tom Hanks), a Federal Express engineer who devotes most of his life to his troubleshooting job. His girlfriend Kelly (Helen Hunt) is often neglected by his dedication to work, and his compulsive personality suggests a conflicted man. But on Christmas Eve, Chuck proposes marriage to Kelly right before embarking on a large assignment. On the assignment, a plane crash strands Chuck on a remote island, and his fast-paced life is slowed to a crawl, as he is miles removed from any human contact. Finding solace only in a volleyball that he befriends, Chuck must now learn to endure the emotional and physical stress of his new life, unsure of when he may return to the civilization he knew before. Cast Away reunites star Hanks with director Robert Zemeckis, their first film together since 1994's Oscar-winning Forrest Gump(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Toula and Ian are parents to a teenage daughter in this sequel that brings the entire Portokalos family together for another huge wedding(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Catch a Contractor
programme.desc: Adam Carolla pursues a contractor who betrayed a friend. When a couple adopted four children, they decided their kitchen needed extending to accommodate their larger family, and turned to a builder whom they knew from school. However, he did not complete the work, taking the family's money and appliances.(n)

programme.title: Driven Underground
programme.desc: After her teenage daughter becomes a key witness to a mob killing and she suspects a leak inside the police force, a single mother takes her family to live in Oregon. However, as they struggle to adjust to their new life, both the police and and the killers start a nationwide search for them. Drama, starring Kristy Swanson, Emily Tennant and Lochlyn Munro.(n)

programme.title: Strangers in Amish Country
programme.desc: Premiere. A military nurse returns from a tour of duty in Afghanistan to her family's farm in rural Ohio, and falls for an Amish neighbour after an intruder wreaks havoc. Romantic drama, starring Jes Macallan, Sean Faris and Kelly McGillis.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Prescription Murder
programme.desc: A psychiatrist having an affair with a patient murders his wife with his lover's help. However, while he establishes the perfect alibi he soon finds himself pursued by Columbo, whose meandering investigative approach conceals an uncanny gift for detection. First episode of the detective series, starring Peter Falk and Gene Barry.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents try to track down an arms dealer who has the launch codes for the Navy's encrypted satellite defence system and is offering them to the highest bidder. In an attempt to win the confidence of the buyer, Ducky poses as an ageing Englishman trying to sell the information. Guest starring Armand Assante, with David McCallum and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A sailor's body is discovered in a disused restaurant, and his death is initially ascribed to an accidental drug overdose. However, Abby discovers a message written in blood on a laminated card found at the scene and realises he was murdered. Meanwhile, Jimmy continues to pursue a relationship with Agent Michelle Lee.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An explosion at a mausoleum exposes a number of freshly dismembered bodies, prompting the team to launch a multiple murder investigation to identify the victims. Meanwhile, Abby has a personal problem to deal with - and it seems Gibbs is the only person she will confide in. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A supposedly dead marine suddenly regains consciousness on the autopsy table, leaving the team struggling to solve the mystery of how he came to be in such a strange predicament. Investigations reveal he had recently been on a trip to Baghdad - and uncover an unexpected link to Gibbs' past. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The unit is tipped off about terrorist activity, and two agents are murdered during the ensuing investigation. Believing the information to be a set-up, the team tries to solve the case with assistance from a guilt-stricken Paula Cassidy, who holds herself responsible for the tragedy. Drama, starring Jessica Steen.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Deeks is rushed to hospital after being shot during a robbery at a convenience store, leaving Callen and Sam to hunt the culprits. Discovering the gunmen were gang members for hire, Callen goes undercover to find out more, while Deeks realises he may have been used as bait as part of a bigger plan.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Don Lambert, an accountant who offered to testify against weapons trafficker Hugo Garza, dies after slipping away from the Federal Marshals tasked with keeping him safe ahead of the trial. In an attempt to ensure justice is done, Pride offers to personally escort a replacement witness - Lambert's former business partner - to the trial in Texas. However, the killer is still out there, and it's not long before Pride, Sonja and their witness face an ambush. Naval crime drama, starring Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A power cut plunges most of the city into darkness, and Pride is approached by his daughter's best friend, Frankie, who claims to have received an unnerving message from her fiance Nick, who has gone missing. Using background noise from his message, the team deduces Nick's location, but finds he has been killed. A chain of evidence leads to an abandoned house containing blueprints for New Orleans' electric grids, as well as the murder weapon, and as Pride and his colleagues investigate further, they begin to suspect Nick's death and the blackout are connected to an opportunistic gang planning to use the power cut as a cover for a looting spree. However, there is more to the case than meets the eye. Crime drama, starring Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and the team become embroiled in the hard-hitting world of ultimate fighting when a teenager's body is found with her lips cut off. DNA traces lead to a cage fighter with a dubious record, while footage from the victim's mobile phone offers a link to two members of a university fraternity house. Starring Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU puts out a media appeal for information on a youngster found on the streets of New York covered in someone else's blood. The child's alleged father turns up to collect him, but tests reveal he is not biologically related - a development that makes Stabler doubt whether Kathy's unborn child is really his. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler investigate the murder of a 14-year-old immigrant girl, and initially suspect the involvement of a thug with a history of violence - but the case is complicated by the discovery that the victim was married to a 35-year-old polygamist.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A socialite's body is found in New York's Central Park, and detectives Benson and Stabler initially suspect her wealthy boyfriend of murder. However, the investigation reveals the victim has been living a double life, posing as a homeless teenager - and the team discovers a street family loyal to its sinister leader. Starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Lake team up with FBI agent Lauren Cooper to track down a serial killer who has claimed the lives of more than 20 women - but discover that he too has been murdered. The investigation leads them to a warehouse where they find a hidden torture chamber containing a surviving victim - but she later dies, shutting down a vital line of inquiry and complicating the case still further.(n)

programme.title: Catch a Contractor
programme.desc: Adam Carolla acts as a vigilante watchdog for homeowners and businesses that have been cheated by contractors and left with unfinished construction disasters.(n)

programme.desc: After her testimony sent him to jail, a woman finds herself held captive in her own home when the man who murdered her father and fiancee escapes from prison to confront her. Thriller, starring Lindy Booth, Craig Olejnik and Jon McLaren.(n)

Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, John Cassavetes, Myrna Loy and Blythe Danner.(n)

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Ricardo Montalban, A Martinez and Pedro Armendariz Jr.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Any Old Port in a Storm
programme.desc: A vineyard owner's financial security is jeopardised when his playboy younger brother threatens to sell the family winery. He resorts to killing his sibling and rigging the death scene to look like a scuba-diving accident. However, the crumpled cop sees through the ruse and in the process reveals he is something of a wine buff himself. Detective drama, with Peter Falk, Donald Pleasence and Julie Harris.(n)

programme.desc: A naval technology scientist is being rushed to hospital with a gunshot wound, only for an unknown assailant to stop the ambulance and finish the job there and then, while also killing everyone else on board. The investigation takes an intriguing turn when the post-mortem reveals an object was removed from the victim's chest, and even more so when an unlikely link emerges between the dead man and a surfer, giving Deeks and Kensi the chance to pull on their wetsuits and head down to the beach. Eric Christian Olsen and Daniela Ruah star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac is found at the harbour in Jersey City, having escaped from a sinking car, but he is suffering from concussion and can recall only scant details of his kidnapping. However, the team resolves to track down his abductor and believes CCTV footage of the suspect driving through a toll barrier in another vehicle is just the lead required. Starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: The team embarks on a desperate search to find the source of a radioactive substance that claimed a woman's life at a concert and hospitalised Sid, who was exposed to it while examining the body. Evidence leads them to the antiquities section of the New York library - and the finger of suspicion points to a former employee who bore a grudge. Guest starring Maroon 5.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A violent sexual assault on a boy draws Benson and Stabler into a culture clash between Orthodox Jews and the secular authorities - but the investigation ultimately leads them to a 14-year-old with a penchant for preying on younger children. Starring Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A number of fertilised embryos are stolen from a sperm bank and the team's investigation reveals several unhappy customers - as well as a couple of outspoken anti-fertility activists who liken such clinics to death camps. programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: Set in 1607, it tells of the beautiful, brave and compassionate daughter of Chief Powhatan who speaks to her forest friends (Meeko the raccoon, Flit the hummingbird and Grandmother Willow, a 400 year old spirit that resides in an ancient tree) for advice. It tells how her life changes when she meets John Smith, one of a party of sailors which has come to the New World searching for gold. The powerful and moving story of a Native American princess and her ill-fated love for an English sea captain, Pocahontas is a stunning piece of state of the art animation. Pocahontas teaches him the true value of life, and how every rock tree and creature has a living spirit. She saves him from execution by her people, and he in turn saves Powahatan but is wounded. Eventually they are forced to part, but their spirits remain entwined. This beautiful and moving story, enhanced by a superb soundtrack, make Disney's 33rd animated feature film an unmissable gem(n)

programme.title: Canvas
programme.desc: Mental illness stretches a loving family to the breaking point in this independent drama. Chris Marino (Devon Gearhart) is a ten-year-old boy growing up in a small oceanside community in Florida. Chris's father John (Joe Pantoliano) is a construction worker who is struggling to hold the family together under difficult circumstances -- his wife and Chris' mother, Mary (Marcia Gay Harden), has been diagnosed with schizophrenia, and while they've been pursuing a variety of treatment options, Mary's condition continues to slowly deteriorate as she hears phantom sounds, has hallucinations, and becomes increasingly paranoid. While Joe tries to explain Mary's disease to Chris, her actions have turned her into an increasingly frightening and embarrassing stranger to her son, and Mary is clearly aware of the toll her condition has taken on the family but cannot help herself. After a violent incident results in a call from the police, Mary enters a mental hospital, and as Joe begins to buckle under the pressure of his circumstances, he quits his job and devotes all his spare time to building a sailboat, a project that reminds him of better days for Mary and himself. Canvas was the first feature film from writer and director Joseph Greco, who drew inspiration from the story of his mother, who was diagnosed with schizophrenia when he was growing up(n)

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: (2010) Michael Cera (Juno, Superbad) stars in this unconventionally structured, inventive and comic paean to the alternate universe of manga and computer gaming. The movie is based on an acclaimed series of graphic novels by Canadian cartoonist Bryan Lee O'Malley, and is directed by British film-maker Edgar Wright (Shaun of the Dead, Channel 4's TV series Spaced), here making his Hollywood debut. Computer game fanatic Scott Pilgrim (Cera) is the bass player with Toronto band Sex Bob-omb. He shares his flat with his slightly-out-of-control gay friend Wallace Wells (Kieran Culkin), and courts a little controversy by dating 17-year-old schoolgirl Knives Chau (Ellen Wong). However, theirs is a fairly platonic relationship, and one he's prepared to ditch the moment he sets eyes on the woman (literally) of his dreams: Ramona Flowers (Mary Elizabeth Winstead). But if Scott wants to capture the impossibly cool New Yorker's heart, he must first defeat her former lovers, the Seven Evil Exes, in video game end-level-style combat. So he embarks on a kinetic, romantic quest, largely conducted within his own head, replete with slapstick violence, impressive effects and witty retorts(n)

programme.title: Fido
programme.desc: This lively black comedy turns the zombie movie on its undead head. All goes well until his electrified collar goes on the fritz and he reverts to his bloodthirsty, flesh-eating ways(n)

programme.title: Bird on a Wire
programme.desc: The can't-miss teaming of Mel Gibson and Goldie Hawn is squandered on a clumsy, illogical romantic melodrama. Running across her old boyfriend Gibson at a Wisconsin gas station, Hawn is astounded that he seems not to recognize her. How could she have known that Gibson was put into the Witness Relocation Program after testifying against a homicidal mob boss (say, don't they usually alter your appearance when they put you in that program?) Curious over Gibson's furtive behavior, Hawn unknowingly sets herself up as a target for the bad guys. The whole affairs culminates in an after-hours showdown at a zoo (a plot device vastly improved upon in the 1996 Arnold Schwarzenegger vehicle Eraser). While Bird on a Wire admittedly has its moments of enjoyment, most of the film is on a par with Gibson's embarrassing, homophobic scene with a pair of epicine hairdressers. And whoever heard of the Chinatown section of Racine, Wisconsin?(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: The Mariner (Kevin Costner) tries to rescue Enola (Tina Majorino) after she's captured by Deacon (Dennis Hopper)(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Paul Walker puts the pedal to the metal in this high-octane sequel to 2001's "The Fast and the Furious." Walker returns as Brian O'Conner, a cop skilled at street racing. This time out, he goes undercover in Miami to take down a drug magnate. The result: relentless action, kinetic street racing and gravity-defying car chases(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: Kyle Reese is assigned to protect Sarah Conor from an unstoppable cyborg sent back from the future to terminate the mother of resistance leader John Connor(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Wesley Gibson, un hombre apocado, descubre que su padre, a quien nunca conoció y que fue recientemente asesinado, pertenecía a una sociedad secreta de asesinos. Después de que una atractiva mujer vestida de cuero lo recluta y lo hace miembro de la socieda(n)

programme.title: Reign Of Fire
programme.desc: Medieval fantasy meets futuristic science fiction in this effects-heavy action epic from former X-Files director Rob Bowman. In present-day London, 12-year-old Quinn Abercromby witnesses the awakening of a hibernating dragon from a centuries-long slumber, the result of a construction dig supervised by his mother and an incident for which Quinn feels partially responsible. Twenty years later, the adult Quinn is the fire chief of a refortified castle community, responsible for dousing the blazes lit by the dragon's prodigious number of flame-spewing offspring, airborne juggernauts that have wreaked havoc across the globe, torching civilization and turning humans into an endangered species. Hope arrives in the form of Denton "Dragon Slayer" Van Zan, an American known to be the only man to ever kill one of the dragons, and Alex Jenson, a scientist/pilot who's a member of Van Zan's army, a zealous fighting force that includes a secret weapon: the Archangels, paratroopers using themselves as bait to attract and then dispatch the deadly beasts(n)

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: The director of the Academy Award-winning 2006 crime drama Tsotsi returns to the helm with this tale of a Middle East CIA operative who begins to have doubts about his latest assignment after witnessing the interrogation of a suspected suicide bomber by secret police. When Egyptian-born chemical engineer Anwar El-Ibrahimi (Omar Metwally) mysteriously vanishes on a routine flight from South Africa to Washington, his wife, Isabella (Reese Witherspoon), embarks on a frantic international search for her missing husband. At the same time, a CIA analyst (Jake Gyllenhaal) arrives at a clandestine detention facility outside of United States. As the interrogation of El-Ibrahimi gets under way, the CIA analyst is profoundly shaken by the unorthodox methods used by the man's captors, and quickly begins to reevaluate his assignment. Peter Sarsgaard, Meryl Streep, and Alan Arkin co-star in this topical political thriller penned by Kelley Sane and produced by Steve Golin(n)

programme.title: The Last Boy Scout
programme.desc: An ex-quarterback teams up with a down-on-his-luck PI whose quarry is murdered while he was supposed to be protecting her(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a group of extreme athletes who are using their specialized skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. Remake of the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge
programme.desc: Hard-nosed army sergeant Tom Highway battles rebellious recruits and his own strait-laced superiors in the build-up to America's invasion of Grenada(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Though ostensibly a family-oriented outing, Ivan Reitman's Kindergarten Cop ensures that fans of star Arnold Schwarzenegger's action films won't be disappointed by pumping up the Cop half of the equation to a surprisingly high degree. Schwarzenegger stars as John Kimble, an L.A. cop who learns that the ex-wife and son of his drug-dealer quarry Crisp (Richard Tyson) are living in secrecy in small-town Oregon. Kimble is partnered with Phoebe (Pamela Reed), a former teacher, who is slated to begin undercover work at the school where Crisp's ex is suspected of working under an assumed identity. However, Phoebe becomes ill, forcing rough, gruff Kimble to take over the kindergarten class instead(n)

programme.title: The Dead Pool
programme.desc: Maverick cop Harry Callahan investigates a series of brutal murders linked to a macabre gambling game that involves predicting celebrities' deaths(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: A film based on the true story of the mission to rescue 33 miners who were trapped in a underground mine for 69 days(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: Doomsday comes to LA in this gripping tale of terror, panic and paranoia. When dirty bombs are detonated over Southern California, a husband (Rory Cochrane) and his wife (Mary McCormack) become quarantined, he inside their house, she outside. As contaminated ash rains down from the sky, chaos reigns across the area as those left out in the open run the risk of being poisoned by the fatal toxins. The film is the directorial debut of production designer Chris Gorak, who also wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Traders
programme.desc: A man's business goes under, threatening to derail his posh existence. In a desperate attempt to keep his life as he knows it, he agrees to cash out his entire life savings and put it all on the line in a diabolical, winner-takes-all fight to the death(n)

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: An ancient assassin attempts to trounce an evil conqueror by teaming up with a coalition of the remaining "free tribes" surviving under tyrannical rule(n)

programme.title: Blow

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Jason Statham leads the cast of this high-octane action-thriller set in the post-industrial wasteland of tomorrow, with the world's most brutal sporting event as its backdrop. A penitentiary full of felons has inspired the jailers to create a grisly pastime ripe for lucrative kickbacks. Now, adrenalised inmates, a global audience hungry for televised violence and a spectacular arena come together to form the Death Race. From expert action director Paul W.S. Anderson and the producers of Mission: Impossible comes Death Race! The stakes don't get any higher than this!(n)

programme.desc: Jeremy goes to India to search for a giant predatory catfish(n)

programme.title: I Was Prey
programme.desc: Blood in the Water. Taxidermist Wilf Lloyd is hunting with his son-in-law in the Canadian Rocky Mountains when a grizzly bear charges. Also: Spearfisherman Anthony Segrich is miles from shore, diving 180 feet below the surface when a bull shark races at him, jaws wide open(n)

programme.title: I Was Prey
programme.desc: Silent Scream. Erin Greene is walking home from a Halloween party in a small Arctic town when a polar bear chases her down. Also: Triathlete Chuck Anderson is swimming in the Gulf of Mexico when a bull shark attacks, biting his arm and pulling him to the ocean floor(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Coral Reef Killer. Jeremy goes to Indonesia to investigate reports of attacks near the island of Sulawesi, including a snorkeler who was impaled and killed by an unseen underwater assailant(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Volcanic Island Terror. A fishing community on a volcanic island in the Pacific Ocean is being terrorized by an attacker that leaves large puncture wounds(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Game of Thrones actress Gemma Whelan (Yara Greyjoy) joins Matt Tebbutt in the studio kitchen to sample dishes prepared by chefs Dan Doherty and Ian Orr.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Former Great British Bake Off winner Nadiya Hussain is in East Anglia as she continues her culinary road trip around Britain, going out to sea with Norfolk fisherman Richard Matthews to catch crabs for Vietnamese-style summer rolls. She then heads to Ely in Cambridgeshire to meet potato farmer and crisp factory owner Ross Taylor, using his snacks to make a crisp, chocolate and salted peanut dessert. Back in her kitchen, Nadiya creates a ploughman's cheese and pickle tart, and a herby chicken and potato salad.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A pair of nurses takes on a duo of paramedics in Derby, with the assistance of antiques experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. Meanwhile, Tim Wonnacott finds an archaic system of communication at the fair, before visiting the V&A Museum of Childhood in London.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Two friends who bought a house together in Cumbria's Maryport discover a surprise in the form of an extra room they never new existed. Developers tackle a terraced house in Burton-upon-Trent, East Staffordshire, and an ambitious redevelopment gets under way in Deal, Kent.(n)

programme.title: I Am Bolt
programme.desc: Documentary about the life and career of world-record breaking Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt, who has won the 100m and 200m gold medals at the last three Olympics. The film follows him as he prepares for the Rio 2016 Olympics and there is archive footage of his personal life and from his athletics career.(n)

programme.title: The Heroes of Super Saturday: Jess, Mo & Greg
programme.desc: Michael Johnson takes a look back at the day of competition known as `Super Saturday' at the 2012 Olympic Games, focusing on Jessica Ennis-Hill, Mo Farah and Greg Rutherford. The former American athlete also meets up with each of the British stars to discuss what happened in their respective careers after that momentous day, as well as looking ahead to what the next generation of stars can expect as they head into the World Athletics Championships, beginning on Friday.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Continent
programme.desc: Anita Rani goes house-hunting in the Poitou-Charentes region of France to help a Gloucestershire couple who are looking for a new start.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts an edition based on the subject of history, as Kate Williams, Adam Hart-Davis, Janina Ramirez, Andrew Graham-Dixon, Ben Willbond, Laurence Rickard, Lars Tharp and Tim Wonnacott try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Richard Osman is the man with the answers.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Two - Evening.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the second night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, which will include the men's 100m final. Should he have made it through to the final as expected, Usain Bolt will be making his final individual appearance at a major championships and will be looking to bow out while still the fastest man in the world. Plus, medals are decided in the men's discus and long jump, and women's 10,000m, the heptathlon continues with the shot put and 200m, and the women's 1500m semi-finals take place. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys D'Movie
programme.desc: The indomitable Irish matriarch discovers that a plan is afoot by developers to buy the famous Dublin street market where her family has run a fruit and veg stall for generations. Assembling a band of eccentric allies, she plans to fight back, only to realise her daughter is not interested in taking over the family business. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll and Jennifer Gibney.(n)

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: Four teenagers accidentally run over a stranger and hide the body rather than inform the authorities, only to find themselves stalked the following year by a shadowy figure who takes great delight in disposing of them in a variety of gruesome ways. Horror, starring Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr and Anne Heche.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Emma Barnett present more topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore three terraced houses about to be auctioned in London, the Midlands and Devon, before meeting their new owners and hearing their plans for development. Later, the presenters returns to the properties to check on their progress.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Catherine Southon and Paul Laidlaw head to Edinburgh to help teams of forensic scientists and lecturers find potentially profitable items to take to auction. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott discovers a clever games table at Saltram House in Devon.(n)

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: A Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Nick Park's Bafta-winning film which introduced the animated inventor and his faithful canine sidekick to the world. Wallace is distraught when his cheese supplies run out, so he decides to take a trip to the moon. All he needs to do is build himself a rocket. With the voice of Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Frozen
programme.desc: A princess with the power to freeze anything she touches loses control of her abilities and plunges the kingdom into a perpetual winter. She goes into hiding, but her sister remains determined that she can be saved from her own magic and sets off on a quest to find her, aided by a mountain man and a living snowman. Disney animated fantasy adventure, with the voices of Kristen Bell and Idina Menzel.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple with exacting requirements search for a new home in the Cotswolds area of Gloucestershire. Meanwhile, away from the property hunt, the presenter meets up with three Olympic heroes.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum visits a Merseyside village originally built by a Christian entrepreneur in 1888 to house his employees, and Rev Kate Bottley meets a 13-year-old singer.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present another themed edition of the general knowledge quiz, inviting high-profile figures from the world of business. This time, Four Rooms duo Peter Ratcliffe and Jeff Salmon take on Ann Summers Chief Executive Jacqueline Gold and Dragons' Den investor Richard Farleigh, The Apprentice winner Tim Campbell and former rival Saira Khan, and lingerie entrepreneur Michelle Mone and former BBC business correspondent Declan Curry.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison investigates the role flowers and plants play in everyday life. She visits a herb garden in Bristol to find out about a common plant that is useful in treating cancer, meets a dye maker who only uses natural plant and flower-based colours, discovers a special kind of pickling, and joins a class of schoolchildren who are cultivating rare orchids.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Three - Evening.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the third night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Great Britain's Katarina Johnson-Thompson will conclude her bid for gold in the heptathlon when she competes in the 800m, but she was expected to face stiff competition throughout the seven disciplines from Belgium's Olympic champion Nafissatou Thiam. Plus, medals are decided in the women's pole vault, and semi-finals take place in the men's 400m and 110m hurdles. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba and Phil Jones. Coverage continues on BBC2.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Sir Francis places Ross in charge of a group of volunteers to defend the Cornish coast after Prudie and Tholly catch sight of French ships on the horizon. George returns from parliament and is outraged to discover that Drake is living in the smithy on the edge of Trenwith land. However, Tom Harry is only too happy to take on the task of making sure he does not remain there for long. Emma struggles to reconcile her feelings for Sam with their religious differences, and Hugh continues to court Demelza in secret. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.sub-title: MOTD: Community Shield Highlights: Chelsea v Arsenal.
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal. Manish Bhasin presents action from the traditional curtain-raiser to the top-flight campaign, as the Premier League and FA Cup-winners clash at Wembley Stadium. Arsenal won the cup by defeating today's opponents 2-1 here in the May final, going some way towards making up for a faltering league campaign that saw them miss out on Champions League football for the first time since the 1997/98 season. With analysis from Mark Lawrenson.(n)

programme.title: The Recruit
programme.desc: A highly intelligent computer hacker is persuaded to join the CIA by a shady agent, who lets him think there is a link between the agency and his father's death. He proves he has a natural-born talent for espionage work, but when he is given a top-secret assignment to root out a mole within the training programme, he begins to believe his recruiter's warning that nothing is what it seems. Thriller, starring Al Pacino, Colin Farrell, Bridget Moynahan and Gabriel Macht.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The Spanish Main
programme.desc: Dutch refugees shipwrecked on the coast of Cartagene in Spain are imprisoned by a villainous colonial governor. However, the leader of the group manages to escape and goes on to become a feared pirate captain. He then returns five years later to exact revenge. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Paul Henreid, Maureen O'Hara, Walter Slezak and Binnie Barnes.(n)

programme.title: The Magic Box
programme.desc: Biopic of cinema pioneer William Friese-Greene, who gave up a successful career in photography to follow his dream of developing a camera that would capture moving images. However, his tireless experiments to perfect his creation would come at great personal cost. Starring Robert Donat, Maria Schell, Margaret Johnston, Richard Attenborough and Michael Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Two - Morning Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the morning session on day two at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. British medal hope Katarina Johnson-Thompson gets her heptathlon bid under way with the 100m hurdles and high jump. Meanwhile, other Brits looking to get off to a good start in their events include 400m runner Matthew Hudson-Smith, hammer thrower Sophie Hitchon and 100m prospect Asha Philllips. Plus, qualifying for the men's shot put and women's triple jump, and the men's 800m heats. With commentary by Steve Cram, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Gennaro Contaldo joins Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to create an authentic lasagne with focaccia from scratch, while Kate Goodman offers a guide to choosing the right Italian red wine to make the perfect match. Great British Menu judge and restaurateur Oliver Peyton joins them for a debate on whether people should care more about where their food comes from.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The team visits Manchester's Museum of Science and Industry, where Caroline Hawley and Michael Baggott search the queue for the best antiques to take to auction. Presenter Paul Martin explores the city's archive films and reads the first ever edition of the Guardian newspaper.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the celebrated quiz as more contenders brave the infamous black chair. The specialist subjects in the first round are the four gospels, Margaret Atwood's MaddAddam trilogy, flags of the world and the colour films of Danny Kaye. As usual, the second round consists of general knowledge questions.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the third of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from the University of Southampton pit their wits against a team from the University of Cardiff in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: A team of geocachers takes on a trio with an interest in Vikings in the quiz testing general knowledge and lateral thinking. The players must make connections between four things that may at first not appear to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of exhibit, salt and pepper, outcast and roots manoeuvre. Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don plants up a new bed of irises and takes pelargonium cuttings. Nick Bailey brightens up a dull and shady space at the side of a terraced house and gives advice on plants that will thrive. Carol Klein pays the first of two visits to West Yorkshire to meet a couple whose outstanding planting has resulted in a garden full of late summer interest, while Joe Swift takes a look at a sloping and shady town garden to find out how the owner has designed this difficult space. Plus, the Dorset gardener who has created an Italianate idyll, and an in-depth look at the pelargonium. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: The Sweet Makers
programme.sub-title: The Sweet Makers: A Victorian Treat.
programme.desc: This time, confectioners Paul, Cynthia, Andy and Diana use original recipes to recreate a Victorian sweet shop, and discover how the quest to satisfy our national sweet tooth transformed Britain. Guided by food historian Dr Annie Gray and social historian Emma Dabiri, the sweet-makers head to Blists Hill, Shropshire, to experience first-hand the life of confectioners in late 19th and early 20th century England. The team recreate a range of Victorian treats to stock their sweet shop, from jars of boiled sweets to their own version of fruit pastilles, and an enormous Easter egg. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Proms Extra
programme.desc: Katie Derham is joined in discussion by tenor Stuart Skelton, soprano Ailish Tynan and gospel conductor and composer Ken Burton. The topic receiving scrutiny this evening is Beethoven's Symphony No 9, which is also known as `the Choral', and was the German composer's final complete symphony. Plus, a Proms centenary tribute to American jazz singer Ella Fitzgerald and her fellow bebop pioneer, the trumpeter and band-leader Dizzy Gillespie.(n)

programme.title: Royal Cousins at War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary examining what impact the relationships between cousins Nicholas II of Russia, Kaiser Wilhelm II of Germany and George V of the United Kingdom had on the outbreak of the First World War. This episode focuses on the story of the emerging divisions and rivalries between the inter-related royal houses of Europe during the 19th century. Featuring contributions by historians Karina Urbach, Miranda Carter and Piers Brendon. Tamsin Greig narrates.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Corporal Jones finds himself cast adrift during an exercise pitting Mainwaring and his home-front heroes against their arch-rival Captain Square - but fortunately, Frazer is on hand to help out. Comedy first broadcast in 1970, starring Clive Dunn, John Le Mesurier and Arthur Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Billy Connolly: Portrait of a Lifetime
programme.desc: A programme celebrating Billy Connolly's 75th birthday and 50 years in the business, as three Scottish artists, John Byrne, Jack Vettriano and Rachel Maclean, each create a new portrait of the comedian and actor. As he sits with each artist, Billy talks about his remarkable career which has taken him from musician and stand-up to Hollywood star and national treasure.(n)

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: 2017 Day Two Review.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents reaction to and analysis of the second night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, as Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter, Steve Backley and Toni Minichello offer their input.(n)

programme.title: What We Did on Our Holiday
programme.desc: A couple whose marriage has hit a rocky patch take a trip to Scotland with their three children, to visit the husband's father on his 75th birthday. They try to conceal their marital strife to avoid spoiling the occasion, but have to contend with the kids giving away all their secrets. Comedy drama, starring Rosamund Pike, David Tennant and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Women's British Open
programme.sub-title: Golf: Women's Open Highlights: 2017 Day Three.
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the third day of the event, which this year is staged at Kingsbarns Golf Links in Fife.(n)

programme.title: In the House
programme.desc: A disillusioned teacher is reinvigorated by a talented student's essays about his relationship with a wealthy family. He encourages the boy to write more, which he in turn reads to his wife. However, the process only ends up feeding unhealthy obsessions in both of them. Drama, starring Fabrice Luchini, Kristin Scott Thomas and Emmanuelle Seigner. In French.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and designer Danny Clarke attempt to transform a stagnant, weed-choked pond into a haven both for its owners and the local wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don plants up a new bed of irises and takes pelargonium cuttings. Nick Bailey brightens up a dull and shady space at the side of a terraced house and gives advice on plants that will thrive. Carol Klein pays the first of two visits to West Yorkshire to meet a couple whose outstanding planting has resulted in a garden full of late summer interest, while Joe Swift takes a look at a sloping and shady town garden to find out how the owner has designed this difficult space. Plus, the Dorset gardener who has created an Italianate idyll, and an in-depth look at the pelargonium. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Chris Beardshaw plants a range of hostas in the Beechgrove Cottage Garden. Hostas are usually tasty morsels for slugs and snails, so Chris also tries out a range of preventative measures. Plus, George Anderson visits Fiona and Euan Smith's garden at Kierfiold House on Orkney.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: A look at green spaces and wildlife in urban areas. Anita Rani visits a haven for animals in Stoke Newington, and helps an urban photographer track a pair of nesting common terns. Sean Fletcher joins Manchester airport's environment team, James Wong meets Liverpool residents growing vegetables on their roofs, Tom Heap investigates air pollution, and Adam Henson meets former services personnel rebuilding their lives through farming.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Three - Morning Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the morning session on day three at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the long jump and javelin disciplines of the heptathlon. Plus, medals are decided in the men's and women's marathons, while Great Britain's European Indoor champion Andrew Pozzi begins his bid for glory in the 110m hurdles. Also taking place is qualifying for the men's pole vault, and the heats of the men's 400m hurdles and women's 400m. With commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter, Steve Backley and Toni Minichiello, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: An investigation into how recent archaeological finds on the archipelago indicate that Orkney was the cultural capital of Stone Age Britain and the birthplace of the stone circle cult. Chris Packham uncovers the secrets revealed by the DNA of Orkney's unique vole, Neil Oliver explores tombs and monuments, Shini Somara experiments to discover how ancient Orcadians could have moved giant blocks of stone over rough ground, and Andy Torbet climbs a challenging sea-stack to unlock the story of Orkney's unusual geology.(n)

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme Mountain Challenge
programme.desc: Part one of two. The naturalist leads a team of rock climbers across Venezuela's tepuis - sheer-sided mountains surrounded by jungle. In the first episode, he attempts an ascent of a rockface that has never been climbed previously to discover what kind of animals live at the summit. However, to get there he will have to brave wildlife, rapids and a run-in with a rickety biplane.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace investigates Europe's largest biscuit factory in London, while Cherry Healey looks into the chocolate added to the beloved digestive. Plus, Ruth Goodman examines the link between biscuits and digestion.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jamie Bartlett investigates how technology companies are shaping the future of the world, and the potential negative consequences of the drive towards progress. He visits Hyderabad, where the utopian vision promoted by Uber has left many drivers on the brink of suicide, questions the impact of more jobs becoming automated, and meets a former executive who fears social breakdown and the collapse of capitalism.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Three - Evening.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the third night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the women's 100m final, which was won by Jamaica's Olympic champion Elaine Thompson two years ago. Plus, the men's shot put final concludes, and the men's 800m semi-finals take place. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba.(n)

programme.title: Gareth Thomas v Homophobia: Hate in the Beautiful Game
programme.desc: Fifty years since homosexual acts between consenting male adults were decriminalised, former Wales and Lions rugby union captain Gareth `Alfie' Thomas takes a personal look at what he sees as the last bastion of open homophobia in sport - professional football. Only one professional male player, Justin Fashanu, has come out while playing the game. He killed himself in 1998. What is preventing gay footballers from coming out? Gareth meets players, fans and managers in a bid to find out.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Women's British Open
programme.sub-title: Golf: Women's Open Highlights: 2017 Day Four.
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the fourth and final day of the event, which this year was staged at Kingsbarns Golf Links in Fife.(n)

programme.title: Capability Brown's Unfinished Garden
programme.desc: Bunny Guinness tries to carry out the 18th-century English landscape designer's plans for his own garden in Fenstanton, Cambridgeshire. Brown travelled the length and breadth of the country, improving more than 200 of the greatest estates in the land, for some of the most influential people of the day, but the design for his own garden never got off the drawing board.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Treasure Islands
programme.desc: Stewart McPherson continues his quest to visit all of the UK's Overseas Territories. His second journey begins on Tristan da Cunha, the world's most remote inhabited island, and home to the entire world population of a spectacular albatross. From here, he travels to the Falkland Islands, coming face to face with a fearsomely intelligent bird of prey, and arrives in Stanley, the capital, in time for celebrations following the referendum in which the islanders decided overwhelmingly to remain part of Britain.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: Giralt suspects Ana's disappearance might be connected to another missing person's case. Meanwhile, a flashback connects Juan with the man Ana saw at Casa Castro. In Spanish.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: Giralt discovers Ezequeil Cortes has checked into a hotel, but has not been seen there for days, and Juan Elias is placed in prison for lying at his initial hearing. In Spanish.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Peter Powell and Gary Davies present the April 4 show, featuring the Special AKA, Thomson Twins, Blancmange, Queen, Nik Kershaw, OMD and Kool and the Gang.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Janice Long introduce performances by Sandie Shaw and the Smiths, Phil Collins, Belle and the Devotions, Bob Marley and the Wailers, Duran Duran, Julio Iglesias and Willie Nelson, Echo and the Bunnymen, the Flying Pickets and Lionel Richie.(n)

programme.title: From Andy Pandy to Zebedee: The Golden Age of Children's TV
programme.desc: The story of the struggle to deliver television programmes for children, who were an often overlooked audience in the days before everything went digital. Includes interviews with pioneers of children's TV, such as Bernard Cribbins, Derek Griffiths, Janet Ellis, Johnny Ball and John Craven. Narrated by Nigel Planer.(n)

programme.title: Slade at the BBC
programme.desc: Noddy Holder introduces a compilation of the band's performances from the BBC archives. Featuring appearances from the 1970s on shows such as Top of the Pops, Blue Peter and Crackerjack, with classic hits including Coz I Luv You, Mama Weer All Crazee Now and Cum on Feel the Noize.(n)

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.sub-title: Nina Simone & Me with Laura Mvula.
programme.desc: The soul singer travels to New York City to explore the songs made famous by Simone that mean the most to her, and trace the late singer's musical roots with the help of those who knew the `High Priestess of Soul'. Laura reveals the influence of Nina's classical training, meets Simone's long-time guitarist Al Shackman and performs with a Harlem gospel choir as she pays tribute to the genius of her musical heroine.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Treasure Islands
programme.desc: Stewart McPherson continues his quest to visit all of the UK's Overseas Territories. His second journey begins on Tristan da Cunha, the world's most remote inhabited island, and home to the entire world population of a spectacular albatross. From here, he travels to the Falkland Islands, coming face to face with a fearsomely intelligent bird of prey, and arrives in Stanley, the capital, in time for celebrations following the referendum in which the islanders decided overwhelmingly to remain part of Britain.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Suzy Klein introduces a concert by the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain, conducted by composer Thomas Ades. The performance features Stravinsky's The Rite of Spring and the London premiere of new works by Francisco Coll and Ades himself.(n)

programme.title: The Richard Burton Diaries
programme.desc: Actor Richard Burton became a superstar of stage and screen thanks to his talent, presence and unforgettable voice - but he was equally famous for his hell-raising, womanising and his two marriages to Elizabeth Taylor. This documentary reassesses the man behind the myth using private diaries he wrote at the height of his fame.(n)

programme.title: Frank Skinner on George Formby
programme.desc: The comedian presents a profile of the entertainer, who was arguably the biggest star in Britain during the 1930s and 40s. Skinner explores why Formby's films and records enjoyed unprecedented commercial success both in the UK and abroad, and performs a selection of the songs that made him famous - as well as investigating the circumstances surrounding his sudden death.(n)

programme.title: Babs
programme.desc: Biopic of Barbara Windsor, following the key events of her life over the course of 50 years. The story begins in 1993, with the actress preparing for a stage performance, before flashing back to her childhood as a lonely evacuee in the Second World War, her rise to fame in the Carry On films and her difficult relationships with her father and her first husband, gangster Ronnie Knight. Samantha Spiro, Jaime Winstone and Windsor herself share the lead role.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: Bouffants, Beehives and Bobs - The Hairstyles That Shaped Britain.
programme.desc: A look back at the iconic hairdos people in Britain have flirted with over the past 60 years. From the meringue-like confections of Raymond `Teasy Weasy', via the geometric bob cuts of Vidal Sassoon, to the big-hair heyday of bouffants and beehives - not forgetting the mullet and the 1970s perms. Part of the Timeshift documentary strand.(n)
