programme.title: The Horse Soldiers
programme.desc: Action-packed adventure based on an actual incident in the American Civil War. General Grant, the leader of the Union forces, orders a colonel and an army surgeon to lead a small cavalry unit 300 miles into Confederate territory to sabotage a strategically critical railway supply line(n)

programme.title: Lonesome Dove
programme.desc: Leaving. Former Texas Rangers begin a cattle drive to Montana(n)

programme.title: Lonesome Dove
programme.desc: On The Trail. A pursuit on the plains pits Gus against a rebel who has kidnapped Lorena(n)

programme.title: Lonesome Dove
programme.desc: The Plains. Part 3 of four. Off the trail, Jake (Robert Urich) falls in with bad company, while Gus (Robert Duvall) shares a bittersweet reunion with an old flame (Anjelica Huston). Call: Tommy Lee Jones. Lorena: Diane Lane. Newt: Ricky Schroder. Deets: Danny Glover. Suggs: Dan O'Herlihy. Elmira: Glenne Headly(n)

programme.title: Lonesome Dove
programme.desc: Return. Conclusion. A tragedy in the Montana Territory exacts a painful promise from Call (Tommy Lee Jones) that takes him on a haunting mission back to Texas. Gus: Robert Duvall. Newt: Ricky Schroder. Pea Eye Parker: Tim Scott. Clara: Anjelica Huston. Lorena: Diane Lane. Dish: D.B. Sweeney. Blue Duck: Frederic Forrest(n)

programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: Secret agent James Bond travels around the world searching for criminal mastermind Ernst Blofeld, and finds an unexpected ally in a troubled young Contessa whom 007 considers marrying(n)

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Crashing on an unknown planet in the year 2029, astronaut Leo Davidson is caught up in a savage society where apes keep human slaves(n)

programme.title: Octopussy
programme.desc: This (13th) time around, 007 (once again played by Roger Moore) receives the usual call to come and visit M when another agent drops off a fake Faberge jeweled egg at the British embassy in East Berlin and is later killed at a traveling circus. Suspicions mount when the assistant manager of the circus Kamal (Louis Jourdan), outbids Bond for the real Faberge piece at Sotheby's. Bond follows Kamal to India where the superspy thwarts many an ingenious attack and encounters the antiheroine of the title (Maud Adams), an international smuggler who runs the circus as a cover for her illegal operations. It does not take long to figure out that Orlov (Steven Berkoff), a decidedly rank Russian general is planning to raise enough money with the fake Faberges to detonate a nuclear bomb in Europe and then defeat NATO forces once and for all in conventional warfare. John Glen returns again to handle directing duties, the second of five Bond films he lensed(n)

programme.title: American Ninja
programme.desc: Kickup in the Philippines between martial-arts warriors and a U.S. soldier (Michael Dudikoff) and his Army buddies. Jackson: Steve James. Patricia: Judie Aronson. Hickock: Guich Koock. Shinyuki: John Fujioka. Ortega: Don Stewart(n)

programme.title: The Way of the Gun
programme.desc: Christopher McQuarrie's (writer of The Usual Suspects) directorial debut stars Benicio Del Toro and Ryan Phillippe as a couple of small time crooks who decide to kidnap and ransom Juliette Lewis, surrogate mother of wealthy Scott Wilson. They figure he'll pay big but what they don't know are his connections which includes veteran 'cleaner' (James Caan), who knows all about finding and dealing with 'problems'(n)

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: The star-studded WWII classic about a mass escape attempt by plucky Allied POWs from a supposedly escape-proof German camp. The escape committee's plan is to liberate hundreds of inmates and cause havoc throughout occupied territory. But their problems include concealing three tunnels from the guards and disposing of numerous tons of soil. Steve McQueen gets on his bike!(n)

programme.title: Flyboys
programme.desc: In WWI, before America joins the war, a group of young American men arrive in France to volunteer as fighter pilots. Under the tutelage of the harsh but fair Captain Thebault, they become aces in the sky, but it soon becomes clear that their life expectancy is short, and only a few of them will see the war through to its conclusion. War drama(n)

programme.title: Bandidas
programme.desc: Salma Hayek and Penélope Cruz star in this ripping Comedy-Western about two Mexican beauties who become outlaws to avenge the deaths of their fathers, who were murdered by a ruthless robber baron (Dwight Yoakam). Sam Shepard and Steve Zahn costar as members of their gang. Directed by Joachim Roenning and Espen Sandberg. Filmmaker Luc Besson co-wrote the script with Robert Mark Kamen. Denis Arndt, Audra Blaser, Karl Braun, Ismael Carlo, Carlos Cervantes(n)

programme.title: Windtalkers
programme.desc: Two US marines are assigned to guard Navajo radiomen that encrypt military messages in the native dialectal during the World War II(n)

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: The star-studded WWII classic about a mass escape attempt by plucky Allied POWs from a supposedly escape-proof German camp. The escape committee's plan is to liberate hundreds of inmates and cause havoc throughout occupied territory. But their problems include concealing three tunnels from the guards and disposing of numerous tons of soil. Steve McQueen gets on his bike!(n)

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: George C Scott, Karl Malden, Stephen Young, Michael Strong, Frank Latimore, James Edwards. Monumental biopic of the great but controversial US military general, George S Patton. The film follows his World War II career from his triumphs over Rommel in North Africa, through his demotion for mistreating a soldier under his command and up to the Battle of the Bulge. George C Scott's towering performance earned him an Oscar, which he refused to accept(n)

programme.title: Windtalkers
programme.desc: Two US marines are assigned to guard Navajo radiomen that encrypt military messages in the native dialectal during the World War II(n)

programme.title: Flyboys
programme.desc: In WWI, before America joins the war, a group of young American men arrive in France to volunteer as fighter pilots. Under the tutelage of the harsh but fair Captain Thebault, they become aces in the sky, but it soon becomes clear that their life expectancy is short, and only a few of them will see the war through to its conclusion. War drama(n)

programme.title: Death Proof
programme.desc: In Death Proof -- director Tarantino's take on such peddle-to-the-metal shockers as White Line Fever -- Kurt Russell stars as an engine-revving psychopath who prefers to take out his beautiful victims at 200 mph. Originally released into theaters on a double bill with Robert Rodriguez's Planet Terror under the Grindhouse banner, Death Proof finds a group of ladies out on the town pitted against a mysterious figured named Stuntman Mike (Russell), whose vintage automobile has been partially modified to withstand even the most extreme auto collision. Though the maniacal driver himself always comes out relatively unscathed, the same certainly can't be said for the poor young lass in his passenger seat -- or anyone unfortunate enough to be on the road when the urge to kill strikes for that matter. With a list of potential road-kill candidates that includes Rose McGowan, Jordan Ladd, Rosario Dawson, and Vanessa Ferlito, Death Proof takes viewers on an adrenaline-infused drive that's as sexy as it is shocking(n)

programme.title: Pumpkinhead II: Blood Wings
programme.desc: A small-town cop has more to deal with than petty crime when his rebellious daughter resurrects the demonic Pumpkinhead(n)

programme.title: Gotcha!
programme.desc: "Gotcha!" is a puerile but popular campus game at UCLA in which students stalk one another armed with paint-spewing pellet guns. Veterinary student Anthony Edwards may not be any great shakes in the classroom, but he's a whiz at Gotcha. His skills come in handy when Edwards, on vacation in Paris, becomes acquainted with the mysterious Linda Fiorentino. She gets him mixed up in international espionage; fortunately, the well-armed spies aren't quite as adept at "Gotcha" as Edwards is. Most of the film was lensed in Paris and Berlin(n)

programme.title: Cat Run
programme.desc: This intense action comedy follows wannabe chef Anthony and unrepentant womanizer Julian as they team up to start a detective agency, and they get in over their heads while protecting a top-dollar escort with evidence of a conspiracy. Now, the mob, a crooked senator and an unusual assassin are all hot on their trail(n)

programme.title: Windtalkers
programme.desc: Two US marines are assigned to guard Navajo radiomen that encrypt military messages in the native dialectal during the World War II(n)

programme.desc: Controversial thriller about an Irish-American cop who wrestles with his conscience when he learns that his new lodger is an undercover IRA operative on a mission to buy weapons(n)

programme.title: In Bruges
programme.desc: Irish playwright Martin McDonagh brings crackling dialogue and pitch-black humour to this tale about hit men laying low after a botched job. Exiled to picturesque Bruges, Belgium, partners Ken and Ray kill time in pubs, museums and medieval churches while awaiting word from their sociopathic boss. The fun is over when he calls with a troubling new assignment(n)

programme.title: Quarantine
programme.desc: A news reporter and her cameraman are assigned to spend an evening shift with the Los Angeles fire service, when a routine call takes them to an incident in an apartment block. Once there they hear blood-curdling screams which lead them to a rabid woman, but on trying to escape they find the building has been sealed and they are now quarantined with a host of murderous infected tenants(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: An officer from Boynton Beach Police Department in Florida chases a man fleeing his car on foot, while one of his colleagues heads to the beach to intercept a boa constrictor.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers from the Rio Grande City Customs and Border Protection in Texas engage in a sting operation to catch people illegally crossing the border.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Naval intelligence ensign is killed in an unusual car accident. Gibbs and his team are reunited with old friend Ned Dorneget, who is now working with NCIS cyber operations, and NSA attorney Jake Malloy to investigate the case, and discover a conspiracy involving terrorist recruitment on the internet.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Special Agent Ned Dorneget of the NCIS cyber division joins the team to further their investigation into The Calling, the insidious terror network radicalising youngsters via the internet. When it emerges young suicide bomber Bradley was not, in fact, affiliated with The Calling, Gibbs and his colleagues realise they might be back to square-one. Determined to bring the organisation down, the agents pursue two new leads, an arms dealer who may be supplying The Calling with their signature German S-mines, and another boy given a deadly mission by the terrorists. Guest starring Matt Jones.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The death of Special Agent Ned Dorneget hits the team hard, and when Gibbs receives a visit from his late colleague's mother - CIA Officer Joanna Teague - he must decide whether to let her help with the investigation into the Calling. Meanwhile, Gibbs hopes his young charge Luke, formerly one of the Calling's radicalised footsoldiers, might be key to bringing the organisation down. However, when the terrorists discover where their defecting comrade has taken refuge, the abduct him and flee to Iraq. The team follows hot on their heels, but it seems Luke's ties to the Calling might be stronger than anyone at NCIS ever anticipated. Naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, with guest Mimi Rogers.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs fights for his life on board a US Navy hospital ship after being shot. Meanwhile, DiNozzo and Joanna Teague head for Shanghai, where they hope to take down the leaders of the terrorist group known as The Calling. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Mimi Rogers.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs throws himself back into his work following his near-death experience, updating his appearance and tackling a new risky case alongside DEA agent Luis Mitchell, who wants help bringing down a drugs cartel. Concerned about his colleague's apparent enthusiasm to re-enter the field, DiNozzo discovers Mitchell is the son of a former NCIS agent who gave his life trying to save Gibbs' late wife and daughter, and this attachment is causing Gibbs to break his own rule against personal involvement in a case. However, a significant danger is posed by Benson Long, the cartel's head, and Mitchell's top target.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is kidnapped, but manages to escape her captor, and the team discovers her abduction may be connected to her missing husband. Meanwhile, Abby knits everyone `gifts'.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Torres discovers a witness in an NCIS case is wanted by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement, while Abby, Bishop and McGee hope to sublet Tony's apartment - by wooing his father.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A girl is found dead in suspicious circumstances and a well-connected classmate, previously accused of raping her, immediately catches Brenda's attention.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A reporter is the first person on the scene when a man wearing a surveillance wire in downtown Los Angeles is shot dead at point-blank range. As Brenda investigates the victim's connection to a drug ring, she and Fritz argue over who should take control of the case.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Provenza and Flynn pose as hitmen to bring an attempted murder sting operation to a close, only to find all their evidence has been stolen while they stopped for lunch. Brenda is forced to free her suspect, and a furious Pope demands that Priory Homicide recover the missing items within 48 hours.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda struggles to decide how to handle the case of a missing boy - and as the investigation continues, suspicions arise as to whether he is a victim or a potential killer. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: When Detective Sanchez's brother is murdered in a drive-by shooting, Brenda and the team try to discover who is responsible - while preventing their colleague from exacting personal revenge. However, the investigation is compromised when residents of the area where the crime was committed refuse to co-operate.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger rediscovers one of his personas, Ricky Spanish, and soon remembers why he is the most hated person in Langley Falls. Meanwhile, an African child who Stan and Francine sponsored shows up on their doorstep.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is embarrassed by Steve's recreational activities, so he takes him to Mexico to teach him how to be more manly - but the plan backfires when they are kidnapped by members of a local drug cartel.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: A Nice Night for a Drive.
programme.desc: Klaus ends up getting transferred into the sat-nav system in Stan's car, and Steve and his friends play a prank on Roger, who decides to terrorise them as he seeks vengeance.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois gets a job as a postal worker to pay for Stewie's private school and finds an unsent letter from Peter that was meant for an old flame of his.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Joe, Cleveland and Quagmire help throw Jesus an important birthday party after running into the Son of God at the Quahog Mall. Animation following the misadventures of America's disaster-prone Griffin family, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Quagmire, Joe and Cleveland form a neighborhood detective agency, and are stunned to discover that Chris is a thief. Meanwhile, Lois is worried about Chris' delusional relationship with his new girlfriend, but also sees it as an opportunity for Peter to copy Chris' romantic gestures.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger enrols in a police academy after he and Francine fall victim to a mugger, hoping the course will help him learn how to defend himself. However, he falls under the influence of a corrupt cop (Bobby Cannavale). Meanwhile, Hayley's new friendship threatens her long-term relationship.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger kisses Francine in a drunken moment at a wine-tasting event, and when she decides to tell Stan about the incident, the panic-stricken alien tries to stop her. Meanwhile, Steve sets out to hone his skills at lucid dreaming, much to the amusement of Hayley and Klaus.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian and Stewie use a hi-tech remote control to visit alternative realities, including a post-apocalyptic world run by dogs with humans as their pets and the Robot Chicken universe. Animation, featuring the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois goes to see the family doctor, who looks into her history and discovers she is Jewish, a revelation that pleases Peter - until a visit from the spirit of his dead father changes his mind.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan bullies Steve in the hope of toughening him up, but Francine does not approve of his approach. Meanwhile, Roger announces he is planning to study crime-scene photography.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan's efforts to get his family in shape for a neighbourhood pool party end in disaster when he accidentally ruins the Smith name - so he decides to fake his family's death and move to escape the shame.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie and Brian discover the people who moved in to Cleveland's old house are spies, and follow them on a mission to Russia. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Alex Borstein.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Brian's Got a Brand New Bag.
programme.desc: Brian starts dating an older woman, but she has an accident and breaks her hip, forcing him to become her unofficial errand boy - and prompting the couple to re-evaluate their relationship.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger is offended by the family during his birthday celebrations, and vows to turn his life around - and take revenge. However, the alien takes things a step too far, causing the family to go on the run.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: In the 100th episode of the animated comedy, Stan and Francine try to stop Hayley from eloping with her boyfriend by offering a $50,000 reward to anyone stopping them. The entire town takes up the offer, including Steve and Roger under the alias Wheels and the Legman. Meanwhile, tragedy strikes at Langley Falls when 100 characters are killed off.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine is found murdered in Quantico, mere hours after calling Gibbs to discuss a possible case. In response, Bishop and McGee go undercover as a married couple to run surveillance on a lieutenant and his wife, who may be connected to the death. Starring Mark Harmon, Emily Wickersham and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A young Navy Seaman is found dead, with his eyes gouged out, after being involved in a car accident. Director Vance makes a rare return to field duty, pairing up with Gibbs to investigate when it becomes clear the killing seems to be connected to the case of Kip Klugman, a former NCIS agent he once locked up for stealing evidence. Starring Mark Harmon and Rocky Carroll.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby visits a pharmaceutical lab to investigate a murder case, but when armed men storm the facility and hold everyone hostage, she is trapped within the building with no means of communicating with the outside world. Crime drama, starring Pauley Perrette, Mark Harmon and David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The notorious Tri-State Sniper appears to have claimed another victim when a petty officer is shot dead in a crowded park. However, when the team discovers the killer in question was already in custody on the day of the shooting, it becomes clear a copy-cat is on the loose. As their investigation progresses, the agents learn the victim was recently found guilty of placing a camera in the female changing rooms of the USS Camden, earning himself plenty of enemies - but did any of them hate him enough to kill?.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Unfinished Business

programme.title: ParaNorman
programme.desc: A misunderstood boy is able to communicate with ghosts haunting his neighbourhood, but no one else believes they exist. When a curse placed on the town by a witch centuries ago causes zombies to rise from the grave, it falls to the youngster to avert disaster. Animated adventure, with the voices of Kodi Smit-McPhee and John Goodman.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk Interview Special
programme.desc: A look at director Christopher Nolan's Second World War drama starring Tom Hardy, Cillian Murphy and Kenneth Branagh.(n)

programme.title: The Boxtrolls
programme.desc: The people of a small town live in fear of underground trolls, which they do not realise are actually harmless. A boy raised by the creatures must convince the townsfolk there is nothing to fear when a team of pest exterminators is hired to wipe out the friendly monsters. Stop-motion animated fantasy, with the voices of Isaac Hempstead Wright, Elle Fanning and Ben Kingsley. Includes Lotto.(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Cleo
programme.desc: A captured Briton is mistaken for a heroic swordsman and promoted to the Roman Royal Guard, with orders to protect Julius Caesar. But the last thing he and the fated emperor expect is an assassination attempt from within Caesar's own circle of friends. Comedy, starring Amanda Barrie, Kenneth Williams, Sid James, Kenneth Connor, Jim Dale, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters II
programme.desc: The eccentric spectre-hunters reunite to save New York from a massive river of slime generated by the citizens' negativity and nasty thoughts. Meanwhile, the spirit of a 16th-century tyrant tries to return to the land of the living by possessing the body of a toddler. Sequel to the supernatural comedy, starring Bill Murray, Sigourney Weaver, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Rick Moranis and Ernie Hudson.(n)

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: A repairman is assigned to salvage the remaining resources from Earth, which has been left a devastated wasteland after a war with an alien race. He discovers a human survivor on the surface of the planet, an encounter that exposes secrets from the past that threaten the future of the human race. Sci-fi adventure, starring Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: The Pyramid
programme.desc: Premiere. A previously unexplored pyramid is discovered in the Egyptian desert, and a party of archaeologists sets out to uncover its secrets. The explorers soon find the tomb is riddled with deadly traps, but this proves the least of their worries when they realise it was built to contain dark forces that they have now unleashed. Horror, starring Ashley Hinshaw and Denis O'Hare.(n)

programme.title: The Master
programme.desc: After leaving the navy, a tormented Second World War veteran with a fierce temper develops an intense relationship with a man starting his own religion. However, the former serviceman's darker impulses remain hard to control, especially when confronted with evidence of the cult leader's dishonesty. Paul Thomas Anderson's drama, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Philip Seymour Hoffman and Amy Adams.(n)

programme.title: Judy Moody and the Not Bummer Summer
programme.desc: A girl looking forward to the summer holidays is faced with a boring break when she realises her friends are going away. However, the future brightens up when she goes to stay with her eccentric aunt and embarks on a series of manic adventures. Comedy based on Megan McDonald's series of children's books, starring Jordana Beatty and Heather Graham.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk Interview Special
programme.desc: A look at director Christopher Nolan's Second World War drama starring Tom Hardy, Cillian Murphy and Kenneth Branagh.(n)

programme.title: Short Circuit
programme.desc: A military robot is struck by lightning and develops a mind of its own. The machine embarks on a series of comic misadventures, but the company that made him want him back. He realises his only hope is to convince the scientist who invented him that he really is alive. Sci-fi comedy adventure, starring Steve Guttenberg, Ally Sheedy and Fisher Stevens.(n)

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: A family of four-inch-high people living beneath the floorboards of an ordinary human home help the owner's son fight back when a dastardly lawyer plans to demolish the house and make way for a luxury apartment block. Children's fantasy, starring John Goodman, Jim Broadbent, Celia Imrie, Flora Newbigin and Tom Felton.(n)

programme.title: Small Soldiers
programme.desc: A hi-tech computer chip has a bizarre effect on a squad of toy soldiers, causing mayhem for their owner as the miniature marauders engage in a series of scaled-down skirmishes. Children's adventure mixing live action and computer animation, starring Kirsten Dunst, Denis Leary and Gregory Smith, with the voices of Tommy Lee Jones, Frank Langella, Sarah Michelle Gellar and Christina Ricci.(n)

programme.title: GI Joe: Retaliation
programme.desc: An elite military team is nearly wiped out after a terrorist organisation replaces the US president with an imposter and has them declared enemies of the state. The handful of survivors seek the help of their original leader in avenging their fallen comrades. Action adventure sequel, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ray Park and Bruce Willis.(n)

programme.title: Child 44
programme.desc: A secret police agent in 1950s Russia is disgraced for refusing to denounce his own wife as a traitor. Reassigned to a remote outpost, he tries to bring a serial child murderer to justice, but faces an official cover-up by a rival, who wants to maintain the illusion that Soviet society is without crime. Detective thriller based on Tom Rob Smith's novel, starring Tom Hardy, Gary Oldman and Noomi Rapace.(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: Four soldiers are sent on a top-secret mission in Iraq that results in them being imprisoned for a crime they did not commit. When they learn the culprit is trying to sell equipment for producing fake currency, they break out of prison to find both him and evidence of their innocence. Action adventure based on the 1980s TV series, with Liam Neeson, Bradley Cooper, Sharlto Copley and Quinton `Rampage' Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Todos los perros van al cielo
Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten rustles up some blue cheese burgers and East Hampton clam chowder for an outdoor party.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares a meal for her husband, including aubergine gratin and peanut swirl brownies.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten makes Mexican chicken soup and chocolate orange fondue while her husband is away.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten goes for dinner at a friend's new waterside fishing shack.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond celebrates her and her husband's anniversary by preparing a Colorado wedge salad, prime rib for five with chimichurri, and rustic country bread with honey butter.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares various meatless meals, including broccoli cheese baked potatoes, grilled aubergine steaks, roasted vegetable panzanella, Italian cornbread and tofu lettuce wraps.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes dinner for her family, preparing a menu of spicy slow cooked ribs, cheesy hominy casserole, broccoli salad and ice cream layer cake.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes five ingredient meals, including a chicken fennel bake, spaghetti carbonara, eggs in tomatoes, veggie tortellini soup and three varieties of baking tray suppers.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. The chef is surprised to discover how many of these plants can be eaten raw, but it does not stop him using them to prepare curried fritters and a hearty cannelloni.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. He goes on to demonstrate the procedure by pickling courgettes with mint and chilli, as well as aubergines with garlic and oregano.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares simple recipes using tomatoes and demonstrates how even the tiniest balcony or backyard can be used to grow fruit and vegetables. He also creates an oven-baked sausage ragu and seasonal salad, before mixing up a pale pink tomato and vodka consomme.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a selection of dishes with the bumper crop of courgettes he has grown in his garden, including a salad and a recipe that involves deep-frying and stuffing the edible flowers. He also shows how the vegetable can be served as an accompaniment to grilled mackerel.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver provides tips on hosting a barbecue and demonstrates simple rules that guarantee properly cooked food every time. He also shows the best ways to cook everything on the grill, including chicken, ribs and shellfish, before revealing his recipe for the perfect marinade.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: The travelling chef heads for New York, shunning the glamour of Manhattan to discover an underground gastronomic subculture run by some of the Big Apple's most colourful culinary personalities. In Queens, he meets a pioneer of Egyptian-style home-cooked food, and discovers two home-run restaurants providing the city's diners with exotic dishes at economy prices.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: During a visit to Cleveland, Ohio, Adam Richman tries to finish the Melt Bar and Grilled restaurant's 5lb grilled-cheese sandwich challenge.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman heads to Phoenix, Arizona, and goes against the clock when he tries to devour 12 slider-style hamburgers with onion rings in half an hour.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Boulder, Colorado, where he takes on the West End Wing King Challenge and must eat a bucket of 50 buffalo wings to achieve success.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, Adam Richman tries to eat a 9lb steak platter in less than 40 minutes in the Sleeping Cow challenge.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman is in Richmond, Virginia, where he goes up against the clock to eat eight super-spicy chicken wings in less than 30 minutes.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: At New York's Port Royal Pub and Grille, Adam Richman tackles the Davy Jones Locker Challenge, a huge platter of seafood that only one person has ever finished.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Oklahoma City, Adam Richman takes on a challenge in which he must eat 29 deep-fried catfish fillets.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman tries the Ultimate Destroyer Challenge at Papa Bob's Bar-B-Que in Kansas City, where he must eat a foot-long sandwich containing 5lb of smoked meat in 45 minutes.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Indianapolis to try the Big Ugly Burger Challenge at Bub's Burger Ice Cream.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits New Jersey to take on the Ludicrous Wings challenge - consuming 12 super spicy hot wings in 15 minutes or less.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food

programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Amarillo, Texas, where he is challenged to devour a 72oz steak, and also takes on a spicy `burger from hell'.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman is challenged to eat a plate of overstuffed sandwiches and fries when he visits Chicago.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman tackles a plate of `atomic' hot wings in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten offers cookery tips and makes dinner for a Broadway producer and his guest - film director Mel Brooks.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares breakfast food, including omelette and banana bran muffins.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares chicken piccatta with buttermilk mash.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten cooks for a friend and makes roasted pea soup, red pepper and goat's cheese sandwiches, with carrot and pineapple cake for dessert.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes a Tex-Mex dinner for cowboy Pete and his family, with the menu including carnitas, mango salad, cheesy refried bean casserole, and guacamole with a kick.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares kicked-up spicy wings, make-ahead sandwich rolls, a potato skins bar and salted pretzel brownies for her football crazy sons and their friends.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: Kitchen Confessional: Four Seasons On The Ranch.
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes red wine pot roast, chicken tacos with strawberry salsa, roasted beet and goat cheese salad, and carrot and squash curry soup.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond whips up chocolate treats, including white chocolate raspberry cheesecake, dipped and decorated waffle cones, milk chocolate mousse, and a chocolate orange martini.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver cooks three dishes to show the versatility of beans, using legumes he picked from his garden - home-made baked borlotti beans, a hearty runner bean stew and a marinated French bean salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver focuses on dishes containing onions, garlic and leeks, using them to produce simple meals including a salad, soup, and roast pork with an onion and potato al forno. He also chats to a gardener about the health benefits of raw garlic.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver uses a variety of carrots in an Indian salad, demonstrates how they can be used to complement a pork chop and discovers why the vegetable is orange. He then prepares foil-roasted smoked beetroot with beef and a cottage cheese dressing.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver rustles up simple, seasonal dishes and demonstrates how to cook using home-grown potatoes. Among the dishes on the menu are Spanish omelette and a roast chicken tray bake with tomatoes. Outside in the garden, Brian shows how tasty spuds can be cultivated in the smallest of spaces.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks using peppers and chillies. The menu includes a spicy pork goulash and an experimental dish of smoked salmon with a zingy salsa. He also joins Brian for a taste-test of the hottest chilli in the world - and it is the loyal gardener who keeps his cool.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Actress Sienna Miller shares her recipe for Tuscan duck ragu, Jamie Oliver cooks a whole salmon in salt and Jimmy Doherty creates a DIY hog roast for the ultimate crackling. Jimmy and Jamie also try to revive the fortunes of the little-known tosset cake, a biscuit associated with the village of Stalmine in Lancashire.(n)

programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Allston, outside of Boston, where two restaurants are sharing one kitchen but preparing totally different menus.(n)

programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a cafe in Cincinnati which is putting their creative spin on barbecue chicken and vegan chilli.(n)

programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a restaurant in Boston that is making a variety of Southern staples including chicken, waffles and tater tots.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: A councillor trying to win the election by attracting the OAP vote incurs Diana's wrath. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Following the death of a resident, Tom puts himself forward as a counsellor to aid and comfort the terminally ill. Meanwhile, Jane becomes confused when she overhears Tom and Diana's discussion over the existence of God. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: The staff at Bayview Retirement Village are sent into a panic when Diana and Tom head off to Brighton for the day in a borrowed Porshe without telling anyone. Comedy, starring Graham Crowden and Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?.
programme.desc: Smiler begins attending a poetry group and is inspired to write verses for an enchanted Marina. When the two go to the meeting together, an anxious Howard needs to find a way of keeping an eye on them without being seen - and Truly claims to have the perfect solution.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler reminisces about a woman who escaped his advances during the war without leaving her contact details, so Truly, Alvin and Billy volunteer to track her down - even though it means a foray into hostile territory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy, Keith Clifford and Stephen Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The first ever episode of John Sullivan's classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1981, which introduced the viewing public to the Trotter family. Rodney grows tired of being dogsbody to wheeler-dealing older brother Del-Boy and decides to set out on his own. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney make a bit of cash on a used-car deal and decide to celebrate in style with a night out in the West End. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del gets his hands on a statue of a Hindu god - which plunges him into the middle of an age-old feud between rival families. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: One of Del's old flames turns up out of the blue, so Rodney and Grandad resolve to extinguish any passion that might still be smouldering in the Peckham wide boy's heart. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del spots another sure-fire winner and decides to enter the highly profitable tourist trade - and with Rodney and Grandad backing him 100 per cent, he is sure his open-top bus tour initiative will be a massive success. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy acquires three tons of lead sheeting, which turns out to be a DIY nuclear fallout shelter, so he, Rodney and Grandad collect their sleeping bags and food and have a practice run to make sure they will know what to do if the Russians attack.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del gets the chance to sell off a couple of antique urns - the only problem being that one of them contains the ashes of Trigger's late grandfather. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Lennard Pearce and Roger Lloyd Pack.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy goes to extreme lengths to impress her psychologist boyfriend, much to Agnes's disgust, while Rory locates the perfect apartment for him and Dino - the problem is, it's in Kilbride, meaning he'll have to learn to drive. Mark prepares to emigrate to Australia. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as the foul-mouthed mother-of-six.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Comedian Jo Brand hosts the stand-up show from the Hammersmith Apollo, introducing guest Michael McIntyre. Topics discussed include Simon Cowell and football referees.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Wretched flatmates Richie and Eddie go camping in the country - but a complete lack of basic equipment ensures their efforts to get back to nature end in disaster. Anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Obnoxious louts Richie and Eddie manage to become trapped on a fairground ride, unaware it is due for demolition the following morning. Comedy, starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: Fran returns from holiday and discovers Manny has resigned and started work at Goliath Books, leaving Bernard to run the shop alone. After sifting through rubbish, rotting food and dead badgers, she resolves to get the errant employee back - but his new boss has no intention of letting him go. With Dylan Moran, Bill Bailey and Tamsin Greig, and guest star Simon Pegg.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: Bernard and Manny are appalled by the nonsensical tales peddled to young readers - so set out to pen their own children's book and get rich on the proceeds. Meanwhile, Fran embarks on a hen weekend with her closest friends from school. Dylan Moran and Bill Bailey star, with Lucy Davis (The Office) and Olivia Colman (Broadchurch).(n)

programme.title: Steve Coogan as Alan Partridge and Other Less Successful Characters
programme.desc: The actor performs at the Blackpool Opera House in 2008, as part of a national tour showcasing a selection of his many comic creations, including Paul and Pauline Calf, Tommy Saxondale, Duncan Thickett and Alan Partridge.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Afterthoughts of a Co-op Manager.
programme.desc: Truly discovers a former suitor of Marina's went off to Australia, and convinces her the emigrant did so to forget about her - and that she should stop seeing Howard out of respect to the other man's memory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Jean Fergusson and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Auntie Wainwright is thrilled to have picked up a bargain at the auction rooms, but puzzled as to what the object is. Worse yet, when she does find out what her purchase is meant for, she still has no idea what to do with it. Long-running comedy series, starring Jean Alexander, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An upset Howard becomes convinced he was abandoned as a baby after a few well-chosen words from Clegg, while Alvin is equally distraught that his newly constructed kite will not fly. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a `Queen Anne' original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters embark on a decorating venture for Denzil. When they find a canary lying dead in its cage, they race to replace it before the deal is ruined. Comedy, with David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del encounters an old flame from almost 20 years previously, and Rodney experiences the joys of dating - but the brothers soon face awkward questions from the past. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Diane Langton (The Rag Trade).(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney mourn Grandad's death, and feel gratified to see such a good turn-out of friends and relatives at his funeral - even if most people are more interested in the food afterwards. However, one of the guests, a certain long-lost seafaring uncle, ends up outstaying his welcome. Long-running comedy, introducing Buster Merryfield to the cast as Uncle Albert.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Uncle Albert has a nasty fall into the cellar at the Nag's Head, but turns his injury into a profit-making opportunity - eagerly egged on by wheeler-dealer Del-Boy. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: May the Force Be with You.
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Del's. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian continues his tour of the UK's most prestigious venues by visiting the Birmingham Hippodrome. Shappi Khorsandi leads the showcase of stand-ups, with support from Tom Stade, Steve Hughes and Paul Tonkinson.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary staggers home from a residential creative writing course to find girlfriend Dorothy in bed with best mate Tony. Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Caroline Quentin and Leslie Ash star.(n)

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Tony returns from holiday sporting an ill-advised beard, which he mistakenly thinks is bound to impress Deborah. Gary, meanwhile, has a problem of a different kind - Dorothy has moved in and he is not so sure it is a good idea after all, especially once she starts filling the flat with `girly' things. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve Coogan is commissioned to review half a dozen restaurants for a Sunday newspaper and plans the trip with his American girlfriend - only to face the prospect of a week of meals-for-one after she dumps him. So Steve calls old friend Rob Brydon to accompany him, and the pair find themselves debating the big questions of life over a series of delightful dishes. Improvised comedy in which the stars play versions of themselves, directed by Michael Winterbottom.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the best food that summer has to offer, rustling up dishes using the finest available seasonal produce. In the first episode, he visits a local farm that produces welfare-friendly animals, exploring the reasons why members of the British public often feel uneasy about eating veal. He also visits Manchester to extol the success of land-linking website Landshare.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and Tim Maddams introduce a `leftovers night' at the canteen, turning a range of foods destined for the compost heap into new dishes including gnocchi, fish canapes and puddings made from breadcrumbs. A visit to Portland Young Offender Institution reveals the success of its vegetable-growing programme, and a nursery-school teacher is shown how to bake bread.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall finds slugs have started eating his soft cabbages in the garden, so he plans to include them on his menu, and there is disappointment ahead when the chef learns his goat has had a phantom pregnancy. Hugh accepts a fishing-cooking-racing challenge and also visits Portland Young Offenders' Institution, where he learns that part of the inmates' rehabilitation programme involves them growing their own vegetables.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall gets preparations for the strawberry fete under way with his gardeners, planting seeds in every available place to ensure large crop yields. The chef spends an evening fishing for river trout as he gathers ideas for what to serve his guests, and apprentice Sarah Bilson is challenged to prepare the perfect sweet scone to earn her place in the baking team.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: First-ever episode of the series in which enthusiastic home cooks take part in a contest to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. The first stop on their nationwide tour is the Cotswolds, where judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood challenge them to make their signature cakes and tackle a recipe for Victoria sponge. The week's final task sees them producing a tricky chocolate celebration cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: With their numbers reduced from 10 to eight, the enthusiastic home cooks take part in the next stage of the contest, heading for Scone Palace near Perth. Here, they are challenged to bake their signature biscuits, scones and petit fours with meringues, choux pastry and macaroons. The judges are Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The six remaining contestants head for Sarre Windmill in Kent for the third round of the competition. Here, they are challenged to bake the perfect loaf, under the watchful eyes of Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. Meanwhile, Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins taste Britain's earliest bread roll and discover the hidden history of the sandwich.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The five remaining contestants head for Bakewell in Derbyshire, where they are challenged to reinvent classics such as peach and blueberry, sticky toffee, and rhubarb and orange Betty puddings. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins discover how the nation's favourite desserts helped change Britain's image abroad.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The competitors reach the penultimate round of the contest, heading to the Cornish village of Mousehole to test their pastry-making skills. They are challenged to produce their own versions of hearty British classics, while Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins examine the history of pies, detailing their slightly more sinister past.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The three remaining contestants head for Fulham Palace in London for the grand final, where they are challenged to use all their skills to recreate the 19th-century tea parties once hosted in the area. Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood are joined by former competitors to pass judgement on the items offered, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present the victor with the Bake Off trophy.(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Ashton Kutcher and Brittany Murphy are a chalk-and-cheese couple who fall in love and marry. Now, all they need for the union to work is to survive both families who disapprove of the match, deal with the well-meaning friends who meddle too much and, on their honeymoon, suffer a selection of Europe's worst accommodation. Shawn Levy's romantic comedy, although occasionally succumbing to America's view of Europe, is held together by the two leads, particularly Murphy's unexpected gift for comedy(n)

programme.title: Hannah Montana/Miley Cyrus: Best of Both Worlds Concert
programme.desc: Fans of Miley Cyrus and her pop-star alter ego on her series Hannah Montana get the best of both worlds with this live concert film. Shot during her 54-city musical tour, this concert captures Cyrus performing both as herself and as Hannah. She perform a handful of song with The Jonas Brothers. THe directors also include footage of the performers backstage. The film is presented in Disney Digital 3-D, providing the most realistic concert experience possible(n)

programme.title: Garfield: The Movie
programme.desc: Jim Davis' famous cartoon cat finally makes his way to the big screen in this adaptation of the popular comic strip Garfield, which combines live action with CGI animation. Jon Arbuckle (Breckin Meyer) is a sweet, if somewhat clueless, man who shares his home with his pet cat, Garfield (voice of Bill Murray). Garfield is not your ordinary tabby -- he's fat, he's smart-mouthed, he's arrogant, he won't do anything he doesn't have to, and would rather stuff himself with lasagna than do something Jon asks of him. Despite this, Jon loves his cat, but when he decides to expand his animal family, Garfield is less than enthusiastic about the presence of Odie, a lovably enthusiastic dog whose only flaw is his extreme stupidity. While Jon is crazy for Odie, and especially likes having two pets that necessitate periodic visits to Dr. Liz Wilson (Jennifer Love Hewitt), a veterinarian he has a crush on, Garfield decides to remove Odie from the picture. Garfield arranges for Odie to become the property of Happy Chapman (Stephen Tobolowsky), a television host who acts like an animal lover on the round-cornered screen but doesn't much like pets on his own time. While Garfield at first enjoys ruling the roost again, he soon realizes the error of his ways, and in a rare example of selfless and ambitious behavior, hatches a plan to rescue Odie from Chapman. Garfield also features the voice talents of Debra Messing, Brad Garrett, Jimmy Kimmel, and Alan Cumming(n)

programme.title: Monsters vs. Aliens
programme.desc: When evil aliens led by Gallaxhar threaten to take over Earth, the U.S. government unleashes the only fighting force capable of stopping them---a motley crew of monsters that they've been hiding away for decades(n)

programme.title: Sesame Street

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Ashton Kutcher and Brittany Murphy are a chalk-and-cheese couple who fall in love and marry. Now, all they need for the union to work is to survive both families who disapprove of the match, deal with the well-meaning friends who meddle too much and, on their honeymoon, suffer a selection of Europe's worst accommodation. Shawn Levy's romantic comedy, although occasionally succumbing to America's view of Europe, is held together by the two leads, particularly Murphy's unexpected gift for comedy(n)

programme.title: Hannah Montana/Miley Cyrus: Best of Both Worlds Concert
programme.desc: Fans of Miley Cyrus and her pop-star alter ego on her series Hannah Montana get the best of both worlds with this live concert film. Shot during her 54-city musical tour, this concert captures Cyrus performing both as herself and as Hannah. She perform a handful of song with The Jonas Brothers. THe directors also include footage of the performers backstage. The film is presented in Disney Digital 3-D, providing the most realistic concert experience possible(n)

programme.title: Garfield: The Movie
programme.desc: Jim Davis' famous cartoon cat finally makes his way to the big screen in this adaptation of the popular comic strip Garfield, which combines live action with CGI animation. Jon Arbuckle (Breckin Meyer) is a sweet, if somewhat clueless, man who shares his home with his pet cat, Garfield (voice of Bill Murray). Garfield is not your ordinary tabby -- he's fat, he's smart-mouthed, he's arrogant, he won't do anything he doesn't have to, and would rather stuff himself with lasagna than do something Jon asks of him. Despite this, Jon loves his cat, but when he decides to expand his animal family, Garfield is less than enthusiastic about the presence of Odie, a lovably enthusiastic dog whose only flaw is his extreme stupidity. While Jon is crazy for Odie, and especially likes having two pets that necessitate periodic visits to Dr. Liz Wilson (Jennifer Love Hewitt), a veterinarian he has a crush on, Garfield decides to remove Odie from the picture. Garfield arranges for Odie to become the property of Happy Chapman (Stephen Tobolowsky), a television host who acts like an animal lover on the round-cornered screen but doesn't much like pets on his own time. While Garfield at first enjoys ruling the roost again, he soon realizes the error of his ways, and in a rare example of selfless and ambitious behavior, hatches a plan to rescue Odie from Chapman. Garfield also features the voice talents of Debra Messing, Brad Garrett, Jimmy Kimmel, and Alan Cumming(n)

programme.title: Monsters vs. Aliens
programme.desc: When evil aliens led by Gallaxhar threaten to take over Earth, the U.S. government unleashes the only fighting force capable of stopping them---a motley crew of monsters that they've been hiding away for decades(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: A dystopian fantasy adventure based on an unusually faithful adaptation of the highly regarded graphic novel written by Alan Moore (the genre's High Priest), directed by Zach Snyder. It's 1985 and Richard Nixon continues his tenure in the White House, massively popular with the electorate following his crushing defeat of the Viet Cong. However, it seems that the American public have fallen out of love with their superheroes, one of whom, Dr Manhattan, was largely responsible for the winning the VIetnam War. Now, he and his fellow crime-fighters are regarded as reprehensible vigilantes and have been banned by law. But, when one of their number - the vile, ironically named Comedian - is murdered, the former heroes begin to re-emerge from the shadows to investigate. They discover that a terrifying plan is afoot..(n)

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Jimmy Tong is a well-meaning but clumsy New York City cab driver who is tapped by Steena, associate to multi-millionaire Clark Devlin, for a new job as Devlin's personal limo driver. After a mysterious accident lands Devlin in the hospital, Tong learns that his new boss has a secret -- when he's not wheeling and dealing in high finance, Devlin is also a secret agent for the CSA, a top-level security agency(n)

programme.title: Dim Sum Funeral
programme.desc: After their mother passes away, four estranged siblings return home to attend the traditional funeral she wanted(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
programme.desc: Christina Applegate stars in this convoluted comedy that comes across as a teen fantasy combination of Home Alone and Working Girl. The premise is all in the title -- when the mother (Concetta Tomei) of a sniveling group of surly kids goes on a much-deserved summer vacation, she leaves her kids under the charge of an elderly distaff granny (Eda Reiss Merin). When granny ups and dies, the kids load her dead body in a trunk and deposit the package on the steps of the local funeral home. The kids are ecstatic thinking that with the big wad of cash Mom has left, they can have a summer of consumer madness. But when they find out that the money has been buried with the baby-sitter, the kids have to fend for themselves to make ends meet. Dream teen Sue Ellen (Christina Applegate) tries working at a fast food restaurant but she can't stand the grease. So, she puts together a false resume and, posing as a twenty-eight-year old, she applies for a job as a receptionist at a garment manufacturing company. The company vice president, Rose (Joanna Cassidy), is so impressed by her resume that she hires her on the spot as her executive assistant. Her deception looks to be working out great -- Sue Ellen manages to hold off the office lady killer Gus (John Getz), avoids exposure by the embittered receptionist, borrows money from the company's petty cash box for household incidentals, and continues her relationship with restaurant employee Bryan (Josh Charles). But suddenly, the clothing firm is set to go under, and Sue Ellen must use her teen fashion sense to save the company and her job . . . and she has to get the rest of the brood involved(n)

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: This feel-good ensemble comedy tracks a quartet of suburban siblings and their families over the course of a single summer. Hardworking Gil Buckman (Steve Martin) and his stay-at-home wife, Karen (Mary Steeenburgen), have just a few months to help their oldest son, Kevin (Jasen Fisher), overcome his high-strung behavior problems before he'll be relegated to special-education classes. Gil's difficult relationship with his own father, Frank (Jason Robards), has led him to become a would-be super-dad for his three kids, so he takes his son's difficulties more than a little personally. Gil's sister, Helen (Dianne Wiest), is trying to raise a moody, adolescent son (Leaf Phoenix) and an independent-minded daughter (Martha Plimpton) with no help from her well-off ex-husband, who's more interested in his new wife and family. Gil and Helen's sister, Susan (Harley Jane Kozak), meanwhile, must participate in the too-scripted Big Life Plans of her anal-retentive husband, Nathan (Rick Moranis), whose overachiever zeal infects even their toddler daughter. When long-lost brother Larry (Tom Hulce) show up with yet another get-rich-quick scheme, he brings with him a surprise addition to the family. Screenwriters Babaloo Mandel, Lowell Ganz, and Ron Howard negotiate their varied subplots with a deftness and comedic touch that transforms this conflicted clan into a suburban everyfamily(n)

programme.title: Tig Notaro: Boyish Girl Interrupted
programme.desc: Comedian Tig Notaro performs at the Wilbur Theatre in Boston. Topics include doing shows in Las Vegas; introducing her fiancée to her family in Mississippi; TSA screenings; small planes; Santa Claus; and misleading text messages. Taped May 31, 2015(n)

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: London's most frequently eligible bachelor gets some lessons in growing up from a maladroit 12-year-old boy in this third big-screen adaptation of a Nick Hornby novel, directed and co-written by siblings Chris and Paul Weitz of American Pie fame. About a Boy concerns the parallel coming-of-age stories of the thirtysomething Will (Hugh Grant), a layabout "serial nice guy" living a posh, carefree lifestyle off his deceased father's fortune; and the preteen Marcus (Nicholas Hoult), a bright but awkward youth who's tired of his mom Fiona's (Toni Collette) depressed, boyfriend-less state. Their paths collide when Will, deciding that single mothers are the easiest romantic conquests on the dating scene, fabricates a two-year-old son and joins a group called S.P.A.T. (Single Parents Alone Together). Marcus is wise to Will's scheme, however, and through some incessant pestering and blackmail, he contrives for Will to date Fiona. Though Will doesn't hit it off immediately with either Marcus or his mother, he gradually begins to open up to the people around him -- so much so that he attracts the attention of another attractive single mom (Rachel Weisz). A U.S./U.K. co-production of Robert DeNiro's Tribeca Films and Tim Bevan and Eric Fellner's Working Title (the company responsible for the Grant-related Four Weddings and a Funeral and Bridget Jones's Diary), About a Boy was co-written by What's Eating Gilbert Grape creator Peter Hedges(n)

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: Adam Sandler stars in a heartwarming update of the 1936 Frank Capra classic "Mr. Deeds Goes to Town." Sandler plays Gary Cooper's role, a kindhearted New Hampshire rube who inherits a fortune, then outsmarts some greedy city slickers in Manhattan. Winona Ryder, Peter Gallagher, John Turturro, Jared Harris(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Comedy about a born fighter who is thrown out of the army and winds up training a group of junior cadets. Major Payne (Damon Wayans) is ejected from the army after his commanding officer advises him that he has killed everyone and that there is no one left to fight. In desperation, the fearsome Payne finds a civilian job teaching combat skills to a mixed bunch of kids at a private school - and the results are hilarious!(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past

programme.desc: Comedy about an inept engineer's struggle to perfect a vital component in a new tank and - two years later in Kuwait - an army lieutenant's struggle to control his tank featuring the malfunctioning component(n)

programme.title: Grumpy Old Men
programme.desc: This cheerful holiday comedy, a surprise box office smash, featured a generous dollop of raunchy, crude humor and was greatly elevated by the presence of masterful performers in the lead roles. Jack Lemmon is John Gustafson, an ice-fishing Minnesota native who has been feuding with his neighbor and former best friend Max Goldman (Walter Matthau) for decades. The battle of wills between John and Max is characterized by crude name calling and harmless practical jokes. Max is unaware that John is having serious problems, chiefly that his daughter Melanie (Daryl Hannah) is experiencing marital woes and that his house is about to be confiscated by an officious IRS agent (Buck Henry). When it seems that John and Max may finally put aside their childish rivalry, however, sexy new neighbor Ariel (Ann-Margret) arrives and dates both men, pitting them against each other more fiercely than ever before. Despite their mutual loathing, the death of a friend, John's problems, and a budding romance between Max's son Jacob (Kevin Pollak) and Melanie may force the two old friends to reconcile(n)

programme.sub-title: The Mother Goose Rappin' and Rhymin' Special
programme.desc: The Mother Goose Rappin' and Rhymin' Special. A unique animated rendition of classic nursery rhyme favorites with a rocking, upbeat musical score, Happily Ever After Fairy Tales for Every Child refreshes interest in the old rhymes for children as well as adults. In "Mother Goose," favorite titles like Humpty Dumpty and Little Miss Muppet are reenacted by famous voices like that of Whoopi Goldberg, Denzel Washington, and Jimmy Smits(n)

programme.desc: The Three Little Pigs. A feminist twist on "The Three Little Pigs" finds the porcine characters obsessed with their weight---keeping it high, not low---at a camp for girls. Voices include Courteney Cox, Tyra Banks, Loretta Lynn, Sinbad(n)

programme.title: The Peanuts Movie
programme.desc: The delightfully hilarious gang from The Peanuts returns after 35 years for their silver screen debut. Join Charlie Brown, Lucy, Linus and friends on a new epic adventure while Snoopy tracks down his nemesis, the Red Baron. Charles M. Schulz's iconic characters are brought to life in state of the art 3D animation from Blue Sky Studios, the creators of the Ice Age films. Directed by Steve Martino. Screenwriters include Craig Schulz, one of Charles M. Schulz's sons and Bryan Schulz, Craig's son and Cornelius Uliano(n)

programme.title: Aliens in the Attic
programme.desc: A kids' sci-fi comedy-adventure from director John Schultz and penned by British screenwriter Mark Burton. Teen maths whiz Tom Pearson is on holiday with his extended family at a remote lakeside cottage, where he and the other children make an unexpected discovery: four small, green extra-terrestrial creatures lurking in the loft. The aliens are freshly arrived from outer space and don't waste too much time in setting about their goal - the subjugation of mankind. However, it's equally swiftly apparent that their chosen method of conquest - a mind-control device - only works on adults. And so the scene is set for Tom and the other minors to make a brave stand against the incomers on behalf of Earth's human population(n)

programme.title: 101 Dalmatians
programme.desc: Live action remake of Disney's classic tale of a group of luckless puppies who are kidnapped by the evil Cruella De Vil who wants to turn them into a dalmatian fur coat. But with the help of some fellow four-legged friends, Pongo and Perdita (whose offspring are amongst the missing puppies) launch a rescue mission and nothing, not even Cruella's bumbling henchmen Jasper and Horace, will stop them! But with the help of some fellow four-legged friends, Pongo and Perdita (whose offspring are amongst the missing puppies) launch a rescue mission and nothing, not even Cruella's bumbling henchmen Jasper and Horace, will stop them! Joely Richardson and Jeff Daniels co-star as the hounds' hapless human owners(n)

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: Owen Wilson and Jennifer Aniston go to the dogs with Marley & Me, a tale of a couple embarking on the adventure of marriage, career, family, and the world's worst dog. At least that's how writer and newlywed John comes to describe his blonde lab, Marley, when he takes the puppy home and finds that the fluff-ball has an uncanny ability to eat and/or destroy just about anything. As years go by, John and his wife, Jennifer, contemplate having babies and moving across the country, while Marley grows into 100 lbs. of funny, wild, completely untrainable canine companionship -- as well as one of the most important people in the family. Marley & Me is based on the best-selling autobiographical book by columnist John Grogan(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
