programme.desc: Laurence Van Dough wants to grab all the riches of the richest family in the world. When he plots to kill Richie Rich's entire family, Richie Rich escapes. He then devises a clever plan to uncover the crooked Laurence and also find his missing parents(n)

programme.title: Garfield: The Movie
programme.desc: Jim Davis' famous cartoon cat finally makes his way to the big screen in this adaptation of the popular comic strip Garfield, which combines live action with CGI animation. Jon Arbuckle (Breckin Meyer) is a sweet, if somewhat clueless, man who shares his home with his pet cat, Garfield (voice of Bill Murray). Garfield is not your ordinary tabby -- he's fat, he's smart-mouthed, he's arrogant, he won't do anything he doesn't have to, and would rather stuff himself with lasagna than do something Jon asks of him. Despite this, Jon loves his cat, but when he decides to expand his animal family, Garfield is less than enthusiastic about the presence of Odie, a lovably enthusiastic dog whose only flaw is his extreme stupidity. While Jon is crazy for Odie, and especially likes having two pets that necessitate periodic visits to Dr. Liz Wilson (Jennifer Love Hewitt), a veterinarian he has a crush on, Garfield decides to remove Odie from the picture. Garfield arranges for Odie to become the property of Happy Chapman (Stephen Tobolowsky), a television host who acts like an animal lover on the round-cornered screen but doesn't much like pets on his own time. While Garfield at first enjoys ruling the roost again, he soon realizes the error of his ways, and in a rare example of selfless and ambitious behavior, hatches a plan to rescue Odie from Chapman. Garfield also features the voice talents of Debra Messing, Brad Garrett, Jimmy Kimmel, and Alan Cumming(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Peanuts Movie'
programme.desc: A look at "The Peanuts Movie," a 2015 computer-animated comedy based on Charles M. Schulz's comic strip "Peanuts." The film is directed by Steve Martino(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: A bullied misfit conjures up two imaginary superhero friends named Sharkboy and Lavagirl, who soon come to life and draw him into numerous adventures(n)

programme.title: Astro Boy
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage heads a stellar cast in David Bowers' animation, adapted from a manga comic-book character, about a robot boy (Freddie Highmore) who is simultaneously trying to save the world and find his place in it. Brilliant scientist Dr Tenma (Cage) is left devastated when his young son is killed during an experiment, and tries to recreate a robotic version of the boy, only to abandon him when he fails to meet expectations. Left to fend for himself, the robot becomes Astro Boy, possessed of a host of useful powers, not the least of which is the ability to fire bullets from his backside. When he becomes embroiled in a plot to exploit a new source of energy, Astro Boy must use all of his gifts to defeat the forces of evil. The array of vocal talent in attendance includes Samuel L Jackson, Donald Sutherland, Bill Nighy, Nathan Lane, Charlize Theron, Kristen Bell and Little Britain's Matt Lucas(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: Greedy heiress Carrigan Crittenden inherits the haunted Whipstaff Manor and discovers that the house contains a treasure, which is closely guarded by three nasty ghosts. She invites ghost therapist Dr. James Harvey, and his daughter Kat, to move into the eerie mansion and get rid of the supernatural creatures(n)

programme.title: Richie Rich
programme.desc: Laurence Van Dough wants to grab all the riches of the richest family in the world. When he plots to kill Richie Rich's entire family, Richie Rich escapes. He then devises a clever plan to uncover the crooked Laurence and also find his missing parents(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: In this sequel, illusionists known as the Four Horsemen return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their name and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul(n)

programme.title: Almost Christmas
programme.desc: An estranged family reunite over the holidays for the first time since the death of their matriarch(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2005 musical stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music and dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show?(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Portrait of a close-knit black family living in 1970s Brooklyn, as seen through the eyes of the youngest daughter. This comedy-drama follows them as they deal with money woes, eccentric neighbors and the sons' troublemaking(n)

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp
programme.desc: 08-30-2016. Scuffles break out at camp; 15 players are cut from the roster; the Rams head to Colorado for an encounter with the reigning Super Bowl champion Denver Broncos(n)

programme.title: The World According to Garp
programme.desc: The 1982 film version of the John Irving novel The World According to Garp attempts to captures the quirky spirit while condensing the Irving original. Robin Williams plays the title character, the son of unmarried, unorthodox feminist Jenny Fields (Glenn Close, in her film debut). Every effort made by Jenny to broaden Garp's outlook on life -- she even arranges for him to spend the night with a hooker (Swoosie Kurtz) -- crams more fears and phobias into his psyche. Aspiring to become a novelist, Garp succeeds in this goal at the same time that his mother publishes her first feminist manifesto. Though successful and happily married to college sweetheart Helen Holm (Mary Beth Hurt), Garp remains envious of his fearless mother, who has taken in the radical "Ellen Jamesians," a group named after a young woman who had her tongue cut out by a rapist. Mutilation, in fact, becomes something of a leitmotif in Garp's life, climaxing (in every sense of the word) in an auto accident brought about by Helen's tryst with Michael Milton (Mark Soper). There is, of course, much more to the story than this: standing out amongst the dozens of offbeat supporting characters is John Lithgow as Roberta Muldoon, a transexual ex-football jock. John Irving appears as a referee during a college wrestling match, while director George Roy Hill plays the pilot whose low-flying plane crashes into Garp's new home. The World According to Garp didn't attract as large an audience as other, more conventional Robin Williams vehicles, though Close and Lithgow would both be nominated for Best Supporting Actor statues(n)

programme.title: Powder
programme.desc: If you're a fan of The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles on Sky One then you'll want to see Sean Patrick Flanery's amazing performance in this acclaimed drama. He plays Powder, an albino boy whose mother died after giving birth to him and whose grandparents have recently died, leaving the 16-year-old boy alone in the basement where he has lived all his life. Emerging into an unaccepting and ignorant society, Powder soon finds his snow-white skin causing him big problems - but he is also blessed with a phenomenal IQ and some kind of ESP which win him friends in the reform school to which he is sent. Here he meets Jessie Caldwell (Mary Steenburgen), the school's head, and science teacher Donald Ripley (Jeff Goldblum), who between them decide to help Powder come to terms with life in the cruel real world(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Christian Wolff (Ben Affleck) is a mathematical genius who works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations eager to hide their dirty money. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, Wolff agrees to help an accounting clerk at a robotics firm (Anna Kendrick) look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated. J.K. Simmons, Jon Bernthal, Jeffrey Tambor, and John Lithgow co-star in this thriller directed by Gavin O'Connor (Warrior, Pride and Glory)(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: Mild-mannered accountant Calvin (Kevin Hart) is stunned when he runs into an old high-school classmate named Bob (Dwayne Johnson) -- once an overweight and frequently bullied teen, Bob is now a CIA agent who's in perfect shape. However, their reignited friendship turns dangerous when Bob asks for Calvin's help with a crucial mission involving the hacking of U.S. spy satellites. Directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber (We're the Millers)(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: A young race-car driver learns the world of auto racing is fixed in this adrenaline-charged, live-action adaptation of the seminal Japanese anime. With the help of his family, he competes in a cross-country rally in order to expose those responsible(n)

programme.title: Soul Food
programme.desc: This hit domestic comedy-drama is based on George Tillman Jr's own family, is about the fortunes of an extended African-American family recalled through the eyes of young narrator Ahmad (Brandon Hammond). Ahmad's world revolves around his grandmother, Big Mama Joseph (Irma P. Hall) and her three daughters: workaholic lawyer Teri (Vanessa Williams), newlywed salon owner Bird (Nia Long), and Ahmad's housewife mom, Maxine (Vivica A. Fox). Each sister is in turmoil. Teri has lost patience for her husband Miles (Michael Beach), who wants to quit the law and take up music. Bird doesn't realise that her husband Lem (Mekhi Phifer) is about to be humiliated by her ex-boyfriend (Mel Jackson). And while Maxine's relationship with her husband Kenny (Jeffrey D. Sams) is going well, her relationship with her jealous sister Teri needs fixing. These conflicts boil over at Big Mama's traditional Sunday dinners, where the matriarch plays peacemaker. The ritual faces extinction, however, when Big Mama suffers a stroke - but Ahmad is waiting in the wings to take her place(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Jamal Malik is one question away from winning 20 million rupees in the Indian version of the TV quiz show Who Wants to Be A Millionaire?. As he answers correctly one question after another, the producers suspect he is cheating and have him arrested. The police agents questioning him cannot believe that a slumdog like him can have the knowledge to win the prize and become a millionaire overnight. While trying to prove them it is destiny that placed him there, Jamal will take us back to the events of his childhood that have the clue to the answers. We will learn about how he and his little brother strived to survive in the mean streets of Mumbai and how he met Latika, his one true love. He entered the show knowing she would be watching it and now every question brings him closer to her(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Hollywood held few fears for Chili Palmer in Get Shorty. Now the former loan shark is after bigger game: the music business. When he hears about the assassination of a music exec, Chili moves quickly to buy up the contract of star singer Linda(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Christian Wolff (Ben Affleck) is a mathematical genius who works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations eager to hide their dirty money. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, Wolff agrees to help an accounting clerk at a robotics firm (Anna Kendrick) look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated. J.K. Simmons, Jon Bernthal, Jeffrey Tambor, and John Lithgow co-star in this thriller directed by Gavin O'Connor (Warrior, Pride and Glory)(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: America's favourite family make their debut on the big screen in David Silverman's comedy. When Homer rescues a pig from certain death, little does he realise the full consequences of his action: Springfield will be isolated from the world by a gargantuan glass dome. It's the only way the government can prevent the pollution that he caused escaping to the outside world and creating a race of six-eyed squirrels. The townsfolk, armed with torches and pitchforks, are soon after him, and the family have to flee to Alaska. But even Homer knows he must return to do the right thing... Warning: contains full frontal male nudity(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: In this comedy-drama based on true events, a down-on-his-luck massage therapist living in Miami (Miles Teller) teams up with a mercurial former classmate (Jonah Hill) to try to make it in the arms-dealing business. After starting small, the pals eventually get in over their heads when they land a 300-million-dollar contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry for forces in Afghanistan. Directed by Todd Phillips(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The sleepy appearance of an Appalachian coal-mining community belies the presence of a sinister toxic waste-dumping scheme that is poisoning local plant and animal life as well as area residents. The murder of an environmental protection agency investigator leads officials to assign Jack Taggart (Steven Segal) to go undercover as a handyman working through a relief mission. It doesn't take him long to discover that the mastermind of the dumping is local businessman Orin Hanner (Kris Kristofferson). Along the way, Taggart falls for the mysterious Sarah Kellogg (Marg Helgenberger), a young woman ostracized for a sordid past and a father who died under suspicious circumstances while working for Hanner. When Taggart's undercover work proves ineffective, he provokes a direct confrontation with the villain and his henchmen that results in plenty of Segal's trademark martial arts action. In addition to kicking the stuffing out of bad guys, Segal demonstrates a real knack for playing bluegrass guitar(n)

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp
programme.desc: 09-06-2016. The Rams travel to Minnesota for their final preseason game before the coaching staff reduces the roster to 53 players in preparation for the regular-season opener against the 49ers(n)

programme.title: Search Party
programme.desc: Distraught over the realisation that they scared away their best friend's fiancée, hard-partying pals Evan and Jason set out on a wild journey to reunite the estranged couple by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: Criminal Activities
programme.desc: Four friends get in over their heads when they become indebted to a dangerous crime boss. Now, they must kidnap a beloved member of a rival kingpin's family in order to erase their debt, and do so without getting caught or killed in the process(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, two suburban parents hire a new babysitter to look after their three kids while they enjoy a night out, but the sitter eventually reveals herself to be an unhinged imposter who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to college when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth to save the planet(n)

programme.title: Her
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix stars in Spike Jonze's soulful sci-fi drama about a lonely writer who falls in love with his computer's highly advanced operating system. Theodore Twombly (Phoenix) has built his career on expressing the emotions that others cannot. His job is to pen heartfelt, deeply personal letters to complete strangers based on details provided by the clients of the company he works for, and he has a knack for finding just the right words for every occasion. Meanwhile, reluctant to sign the papers that will finalize his divorce to his childhood sweetheart, depressed Theodore has slowly withdrawn from his supportive social circle, which includes his longtime friend Amy (Amy Adams), herself floundering in a failed marriage. When Theodore purchases a new state-of-the-art computer operating system with the ability to learn and grow with the user, he sits down at his desk and prepares to get his life in order. Adopting the name Samantha (Scarlett Johansson), the perceptive software slowly begins to bring Theodore out of his shell by encouraging him to start dating again, and joining him everywhere he goes. Very quickly, their relationship turns intimate, with Theodore teaching Samantha what it means to feel human and Samantha giving him the strength to walk away from his failed marriage. Things soon get complicated, however, when Samantha's rapidly evolving knowledge base begins to alter the very core of their relationship(n)

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: Action thriller about an anti-terrorist squad on an airborne mission to rescue a Washington-bound plane from hijackers armed with nerve gas. With millions of lives at stake and authorities anxious to shoot the plane down, a desperate mission is authorised to board and retake the plane in flight, but success depends on the skills of a desk-bound civil servant(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This reimagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the mad scientist builds an undead creature that soon becomes a grave danger, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself(n)

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: This stunning sci-fi sequel finds the nations of Earth banding together to fight off a second alien invasion, 20 years after the first attack brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered extraterrestrial technology, the alliance readies itself for a massive war(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to college when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth to save the planet(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing
programme.desc: Jill Sprecher's film follows five New Yorkers whose lives intertwine, from eternal optimist Alan Arkin to his pessimistic colleague John Turturro, with Matthew McConaughey as a hot-shot lawyer whose life is derailed by a road accident(n)

programme.title: The Island of Dr. Moreau
programme.desc: A demented doctor spends years on a desolate tropical island working on a drug that will effectively alter animals into humans. Based on the novel by H.G. Wells(n)

programme.title: My Fellow Americans
programme.desc: Jack Lemmon and James Garner team up for this hysterical comedy about a couple of ex-presidents who realise that they are being set up by the current occupant of the White House. Russell Kramer (Lemmon) and Matthew Douglas (Garner) could not be more different - they come from opposite ends of the political spectrum and move in different circles - in fact, the only thing they share is an utter loathing for one another! That all has to change when they both realise that they have been set up to take the blame for a major scandal which is about to rock the current President. Heading into the real America to search for the evidence which will clear their names, our heroes soon find themselves becoming unlikely best friends while encountering a variety of bizarre characters!(n)

programme.title: Crimson Tide
programme.desc: A radical group has seized control of a nuclear missile base and the USS Alabama, a state-of-the-art nuclear submarine, has been ordered into action in this taut thriller. But when a fragmented message arrives onboard to launch a defensive strike against the enemy, suddenly a fiery battle of wills erupts between the veteran sub commander - who never questions orders - and his more cautious second officer, who can't help but suspect a command to start a nuclear war. Gene Hackman and Denzel Washington star(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: A pop singer receives threatening notes and her manager hires a bodyguard. He ruffles the singer's feathers and most of her entourage by tightening security more than they feel is necessary. Eventually, the bodyguard and the singer start an affair and she begins to believe his precautions are necessary(n)

programme.title: Frost/Nixon
programme.desc: Frank Langella reprises his Tony Award-winning role in director Ron Howard's adaptation of Peter Morgan's acclaimed Broadway hit that recreates the explosive 1977 TV interview between disgraced former president Richard Nixon and David Frost(n)

programme.title: Nixon By Nixon: In His Own Words
programme.desc: Clips of declassified audiotapes of White House conversations featuring candid observations by former president Richard Nixon (1913-94) on the Vietnam War, the Pentagon Papers, the Supreme Court, people of color, women, Jews and the media(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Birth of a Nation'
programme.desc: A look at "The Birth of a Nation," a 2016 dramatic retelling of American-born Nat Turner's bloody rebellion to free slaves in Virginia in 1831. The film stars Nate Parker, Aja Naomi King and Armie Hammer, and is written and directed by Parker(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Bull Rush. Spencer goes to Las Vegas on business and gets reacquainted with an old flame who's working for Wayne. Meanwhile, Jason finds himself in a tough neighborhood after Joe sets him up to represent a top running back; Ricky challenges the odds in a game of dice; Charles gets a lesson in public speaking from Julie; and Vernon and Reggie mull a risky endorsement deal(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Hella Questions. A cryptic encounter tests Issa's interpretive skills; Lawrence mulls some important decisions; Molly plots to join the office "boys club" after being on the receiving end of a few harsh truths; Issa and Frieda deal with a difficult vice principal(n)

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: A young misfit fulfils his ambition of joining a notorious gang of outlaws and meeting its enigmatic and celebrated leader, whom he has long idolised. As he spends more time with the group, however, he begins to resent his hero's capricious attitude and fear for his own life(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: Based on the graphic novel by A.J. Lieberman and Nick Thornborrow, this Focus World production directed by Peter Billingsley stars Vince Vaughn as an unscrupulous criminal who learns that he's been targeted by the entire underworld, prompting him to take out a million-dollar insurance policy to benefit his estranged daughter (Hailee Steinfeld). With 21 days until the policy takes effect, he must survive long enough for her to receive the payout(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner (Nate Parker). Turner is ordered by his master (Armie Hammer) to tour a number of local plantations, delivering sermons to the other slaves that will urge them against violence and any thoughts of rebellion. However, he is so appalled and sickened by the horrors he sees during his travels that he is eventually moved to fight back against the evils of slavery. Aja Naomi King and Gabrielle Union co-star. Parker wrote, directed, and stars in The Birth of a Nation, which won the Grand Jury Prize at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Autism Under the Lens. Gianna Toboni reports on work being done at the forefront of autism research, meets families trying out the newest treatments and discovers a growing self-advocacy movement in the autism community that wants to refocus the science(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Alex Jones. Alex Jones and InfoWars; Donald Trump's transgender military ban; Anthony Scaramucci; and the Senate's failure to pass the Health Care Freedom Act are discussed(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger woos a young woman and brings her to his mansion atop a clay mountain. There, she learns that her new home holds many disturbing secrets as she fights for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators battle a malevolent entity that's haunting a family living in a remote farmhouse(n)

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: A sleep-deprived detective plays an intense cat-and-mouse game with a sly murderer in a remote Alaska town. A remake of the 1997 Norwegian film of the same name(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: Freeman is hired to chauffeur the difficult Tandy in racially tense 1960's South. The two develop an eventual relationship and love for each other with terrific performances across the board and enough sincerity to break even the toughest audience(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: Segments include an interview with Chechen leader and MMA figure Ramzan Kadyrov; a look at global warming's effect on the Great Barrier Reef; a visit with MLB Hall of Famer Rod Carew, who underwent a heart and kidney transplant last December(n)

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In this well-acted fantasy about changing history, James Caviezel plays a grieving cop who hears the voice of his dead father (Dennis Quaid) while experimenting with a ham-radio set. Together, they try to stop the events that led to the man's death. Andre Braugher(n)

programme.title: Indignation
programme.desc: A young Jewish atheist attends college in 1951 Ohio, where he clashes with the school's established social order and his parents' hopes for his future. At the same time, he falls for an attractive, complicated classmate in this captivating period drama(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Queen's Justice. Daenerys holds court; Cersei returns a gift; Jaime learns from his mistakes(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Alex Jones. Alex Jones and InfoWars; Donald Trump's transgender military ban; Anthony Scaramucci; and the Senate's failure to pass the Health Care Freedom Act are discussed(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: While Christmas shopping in New York for their respective partners, Jonathan and Sara meet by chance and fall in love before the day is over. At the end of the evening, Sara jumps in a cab and leaves, saying that if they are meant to be together, fate will find a way. Years later, as both are ready to marry different partners, destiny does indeed bring them back together and they rekindle their love(n)

programme.title: Room 104
programme.desc: Pizza Boy. A pizza delivery boy gets caught up in a couple's twisted games(n)

programme.title: Sunshine State
programme.desc: A woman and her new husband returns to her hometown roots in coastal northern Florida, and must deal with family, business, and encroaching real estate development(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Christian Wolff (Ben Affleck) is a mathematical genius who works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations eager to hide their dirty money. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, Wolff agrees to help an accounting clerk at a robotics firm (Anna Kendrick) look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated. J.K. Simmons, Jon Bernthal, Jeffrey Tambor, and John Lithgow co-star in this thriller directed by Gavin O'Connor (Warrior, Pride and Glory)(n)

programme.title: Indignation
programme.desc: A young Jewish atheist attends college in 1951 Ohio, where he clashes with the school's established social order and his parents' hopes for his future. At the same time, he falls for an attractive, complicated classmate in this captivating period drama(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: While Christmas shopping in New York for their respective partners, Jonathan and Sara meet by chance and fall in love before the day is over. At the end of the evening, Sara jumps in a cab and leaves, saying that if they are meant to be together, fate will find a way. Years later, as both are ready to marry different partners, destiny does indeed bring them back together and they rekindle their love(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Susan Sarandon, Michelle Pfeiffer and Cher star in this Oscar nominated comedy as three bored, single women who dream of a man that can satisfy their desires. But when a filthy rich, mysterious man arrives in their lives, things start to get interesting(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Mr. Penroy's Vacation. Jessica is perplexed by the apparent murder of an elderly man points to two simple-minded, spinster sisters he was living with(n)

programme.title: Hart to Hart
programme.desc: Emily by Hart. Jennifer's suspicion about her friend's suicide seems well-founded when it's learned she was investigating a shady crop-dusting service. Stefanie Powers, Robert Wagner, Lionel Stander. Mike: Andrew Robinson(n)

programme.title: Hart to Hart
programme.desc: Pounding Harts. Freeway's traveling case is switched with another---containing cocaine. Robert Wagner, Stefanie Powers. Susy: Shelley Smith. Beck: Edward Winter(n)

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: The Diner. Matlock recalls his first case: defending a cook accused of murdering a sheriff(n)

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: Requiem for a Falling Star. Requiem for a Falling Star features Anne Baxter as a fading movie queen. And is her face red--Baxter had intended to murder a vicious gossip columnist, but accidently kills her own secretary instead. Only briefly at a loss, Baxter endeavors to pin the blame for the secretary's demise on the columnist. Lt. Columbo (Peter Falk) suspects that the "falling star" is attempting to obfuscate the facts. This January 21, 1973 Columbo episode co-stars Mel Ferrer, Kevin McCarthy and Frank Converse(n)

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A Stitch in Crime. This film was first aired as an episode of TV's Columbo. A brilliant, ambitious heart surgeon, jealous of an equally brilliant associate, arranges for his rival's death on the operating table. No one could possibly suspect him of deliberately killing his patient -- no one but Columbo, that is(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Candidate. Part 1 of 2. Obsessive-compulsive ex-cop Adrian Monk comes out of a forced retirement to investigate the murder of a politician's bodyguard(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Candidate. Conclusion. Obsessive-compulsive ex-cop Adrian Monk comes out of a forced retirement to investigate the murder of a politician's bodyguard(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Psychic. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Meets Dale the Whale
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Meets Dale the Whale. A murder investigation leads Monk and Sharona to an obnoxious, obese tycoon who claims innocence on the basis of his inability to climb out of bed(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Goes to the Carnival
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Goes to the Carnival. An amusement park ride takes a serious turn when an informant is murdered on a ferris wheel. The only suspect is a cop, and even Monk thinks he did it(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Goes to the Asylum
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Goes to the Asylum. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Billionaire Mugger
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Billionaire Mugger. Apparently suffering from a mid-life crisis that causes moments of bizarre whimsy, billionaire computer executive Sidney Teal (J.C. McKenzie) pulls a gun and attempts to rob a couple outside a restaurant--and is killed in the process. Though beset with financial problems, and facing the possible loss of his trusted nurse Sharona (Bitty Schram), Monk (Tony Shalhoub)agrees to investigate Teal's death, and the reasons behind it. Perhaps the answer can be gleaned from the two people whom the dead man mugged...or perhaps the solution is in the hands of Officer Moretta (Jonathan Rannells) the cop at the crime scene who inexplicably ran away before back-up arrived--and hasn't been seen since. (Note: the scene in which Monk discusses clues pertaining to the earlier death of his wife with writer Kelly Street [Mary Black] was actually filmed for, but removed from, Monk's two-hour pilot episode)(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Other Woman
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Other Woman. Monk vowed celibacy when his wife died but is struggling to resist beautiful divorcee and murder suspect Monica. What will he risk to clear her?(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk and the Marathon Man
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Marathon Man. During the running of a citywide marathon, Gwen Zaleski (Brandi Marie Ward) killed in a 21-story fall. Under normal circumstances, the principal suspect would be Gwen's lover, brash young furniture mogul Trevor McDowell (Peter Outerbridge). But McDowell has the perfect alibi: He was running in the marathon, and he has irrefutable evidence to prove it. Still convinced that McDowell is guilty, Monk hopes that he can prove his theory with the roundabout assistance of his lifelong idol, legendary Nigerian marathoner Tonday Mawaaka (Zakes Mokae)--not to mention his own long-suppressed running skills!(n)

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: A doctor dabbles in magical resurrection with horrific consequences in this supernatural thriller adapted from the novel by Stephen King. When Dr. Louis Creed (Dale Midkiff) and his family move from Chicago to an old farmhouse in rural Maine, their only concern is the busy highway that flanks their new home. Louis' family -- wife Rachel (Denise Crosby), daughter Ellie (Blaze Berdahl), and toddler Gage (Miko Hughes) -- soon meet kindly old duffer Jud Crandall (Fred Gwynne), who introduces them all to the local attractions, including a pet cemetary built on the remains of a Native American burial ground. When Rachel and the kids head off to visit Louis' in-laws, Ellie's cat gets flattened by a truck. Jud counsels Louis to bury it in the old Indian portion of the cemetary; the next day, it returns from the dead, carrying with it the stink of the earth and a decidedly bad attitude. Shortly thereafter, Louis is tempted to use the cemetary's magical powers again when his son suffers a tragic accident. A snarling kitty, it turns out, is nothing compared to the horror of a little boy with no soul and a taste for scalpels. In addition to adapting his own novel for the screen, writer King appeared in a brief cameo as the minister presiding over Gage's funeral. Director Mary Lambert would return with Pet Sematary Two(n)

programme.title: Pet Sematary II
programme.desc: A liberal dose of humour is lumped in with the horror in this sequel to the 1989 hit based on Stephen King's novel. Edward Furlong is Geoff, the new kid in a small Maine town, whose veterinarian father has relocated after the death of his wife. After a friend's dog is killed, Geoff and the boy discover and make use of a 'sematary' with the power to reanimate the dead..(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers 2
programme.desc: The Creeper is back, and he's brought his appetite with him in director Victor Salva's sequel to his popular 2001 sleeper. Stranded on the dreaded East 9 Highway while returning home from winning the championship game, a group of basketball players, cheerleaders, and coaches quickly realize that there's more to fear than a broken down bus when The Creeper descends mercilessly upon them. As his 23-day feeding frenzy draws to a close, The Creeper needs the sort of nourishment only a vital group of young athletes can provide, and to survive the night, the terrified teens will have to fight to their dying breaths(n)

With Amy Irving and William Katt. M,W,R,HD(n)

She kills one of her targets, and the shabby sleuth is assigned to the case. As she faces his well-honed approach to sniffing out a suspect, she plots to murder his wife. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Helen Shaver and Ian McShane.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Religious fanatic Steven Mullan is found beaten and drowned in his bath. Lewis and Hathaway discover he had been imprisoned for trying to kill well-known atheist Tom Rattan and had only recently been released. The inspector soon has reason to believe the Rattan family is hiding something from him - but nothing prepares him for the evidence Dr Hobson uncovers at the post-mortem. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star, with guest appearances by Jenny Seagrove and Julian Wadham.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: An American female bishop visiting St Gerard's College is found dead after drinking poisoned wine, and when another two killings occur, both mirroring macabre murders from Jacobean revenge tragedy, it appears the culprit is targeting candidates in the election to become vice-regent. However, when Innocent learns one of the suspects is hiding a dark secret, Lewis and Hathaway realise the motive is much more twisted. Guest starring Sian Phillips and Ronald Pickup, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Ever since a beautiful American woman arrived in the peaceful village of Wychwood-under-Ashe, people have begun to die in a series of apparent accidents. Nobody suspects a killer is at work but, as the body count rises, Miss Marple digs a little deeper with the help of a former policeman - and they gradually unearth a secret that will rock the village to its core. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War

However, an aerial photo of a German village found in the dead man's pocket leads Milner to suspect murder. The newly retired Foyle is compelled to return to service when events take an even more unexpected turn. Wartime crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks agrees to help old friend and partner Jimmy Valentine with an undercover drug sting, but when the bust goes wrong and a dealer ends up dead, suspicion falls on the officers. As Devlin pushes for the truth, the spotlight turns on Brooks' dark past, and a 10-year-old case involving no witnesses and a large quantity of missing heroin. Guest starring Hustle's Robert Glenister, former Rising Damp star Don Warrington and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral), alongside Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Freema Agyeman.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Two children go on trial for killing a toddler, each blaming the other, and the case hinges on whether forensic evidence can prove who is guilty of strangling the boy to death. CPS director George Castle defies his superiors and takes instruction from the victim's mother, who has a surprising point of view on the crime. Drama, guest starring Deborah Findlay (Cranford), with Bill Paterson.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When a 16-year-old girl is found dead in her home, Brooks and Devlin cannot be sure a crime was even committed. On further investigation, an unlikely murder weapon is uncovered and a suspect identified - a recently released serial rapist. Determined the accused is guilty, Steel pursues him with every power available - pushing the boundaries of the law to the limit. Crime drama, guest starring Kevin Doyle (Drop Dead Gorgeous), with Ben Daniels.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan believes living at home is cramping his style and resolves to find his own place. Vintage comedy with Reg Varney and Bob Grant.(n)

programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Ever since a beautiful American woman arrived in the peaceful village of Wychwood-under-Ashe, people have begun to die in a series of apparent accidents. Nobody suspects a killer is at work but, as the body count rises, Miss Marple digs a little deeper with the help of a former policeman - and they gradually unearth a secret that will rock the village to its core. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, Benedict Cumberbatch, David Haig, Sylvia Syms, Margo Stilley and Hugo Speer.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy chases joyriders tearing through Aidensfield and accidentally runs down Don Dibley's son during the pursuit. The boy's father demands compensation, but soon realises his problems have just begun as his daughter reveals she is pregnant. Steve finds himself in trouble and David invents a novel way to rid the estate of moles. Rural drama, starring Mark Jordon, James Carlton and Ted Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A recently widowed woman arrives in Aidensfield wanting to bury her husband in the family grave, but the deceased's brother refuses to co-operate because of an old feud. Vernon and David get involved and find themselves held at gunpoint as a shocking case of fraud is uncovered. Rural drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes and David Lonsdale.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.sub-title: The Dark Side of the Door.
programme.desc: Jessica examines a recent murder which the police are reluctant to investigate, and discovers a link between the killing and an abduction 11 years previously. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Disaster strikes on the set of a TV sitcom when the producer is killed in cold blood - leaving Jessica to determine whether one of the show's actors might have done the deed, or if somebody else bears a grudge. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Cast Not Your Pearls Before Swine - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Roger returns to Liverpool, while Pop discovers Edith's new boyfriend George is a con-artist defrauding the ministry - and resolves to teach him a lesson. David Jason stars.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Butterfly in Shades of Grey
programme.desc: A radio presenter is plotting to sabotage his adopted daughter's plans to publish her first novel and kills one of his employees for trying to help her. He thinks he has the perfect alibi, claiming that the victim was murdered while they were talking to each other on the phone, and there is a tape recording to prove it - but his ruse fails to fool the dishevelled detective. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, William Shatner and Molly Hagan.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective and his team embark on a race against time to recapture a dangerous convict who has escaped from Bodmin prison - a case that leads them to an elaborate drugs racket. Starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters, Jimmy Yuill and Sean Chapman.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: When an RAF officer is found hanged in a wood, Meredith - the new chief superintendent at Hastings - is quick to dismiss it as a straightforward suicide. However, an aerial photo of a German village found in the dead man's pocket leads Milner to suspect murder. The newly retired Foyle is compelled to return to service when events take an even more unexpected turn. Wartime crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Religious fanatic Steven Mullan is found beaten and drowned in his bath. Lewis and Hathaway discover he had been imprisoned for trying to kill well-known atheist Tom Rattan and had only recently been released. The inspector soon has reason to believe the Rattan family is hiding something from him - but nothing prepares him for the evidence Dr Hobson uncovers at the post-mortem. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star, with guest appearances by Jenny Seagrove and Julian Wadham.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is delighted that his heroes Hired Gun are reuniting to play at the Midsomer Rocks festival - minus their drummer, who disappeared 30 years ago after driving his car into a quarry. However, a string of bizarre warnings convinces the paranoid lead singer that someone is trying to stop the reunion, and his fears are confirmed when the backing singer drops dead on stage. Radio 2 host Suzi Quatro guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Three people are murdered in a shop in central London and a fourth is left for dead, and Brooks and Devlin are up against the clock to find a killer who they fear could strike again. When a suspect is brought to trial, Steel's hopes for a relatively straightforward case are dashed when he finds himself pitted against a brilliant defence lawyer. Crime drama, guest starring Rupert Graves and Amanda Root.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When police sergeant Pete Garvey is killed, the investigation proves harrowing for Devlin as he was one of his best friends. The detective discovers the officer had recently been in contact with their childhood parish priest Jonathan Nugent, who Pete claimed sexually abused him as a child. Unable to place a straightforward murder charge against Nugent, Steel and Phillips take an unusual approach to bring him to trial. Guest starring Matthew Marsh, Ruth Gemmell and Patrick Malahide, with Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew takes up rally driving in the desperate hope it will help him forget Erica. Medical drama, starring Gary Mavers, Adrian Lukis and Haydn Gwynne.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Stuart has a lot of explaining to do when a medical procedure goes badly wrong, and Jack is quick to use the blunder as an example of Robert's lack of leadership. Meanwhile, Judy learns her father's cancer has returned, and Andrew remains traumatised by recent events, causing him to shirk his responsibilities. Sam and Mike revel in the fact that they're hospital gossip. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack decides to implement a new policy and Richard comes to suspect he and Christine are working as a team in more ways than one. Robert goes on the warpath over the new protocol and threatens to hand in his notice. Meanwhile, Judy's worst fears are confirmed after her father's operation, and the powers that be conspire to cover up a case of steroid abuse by a VIP's son. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A respected Polish-born doctor is prosecuted for his alleged involvement in Nazi war crimes during the Second World War, forcing victims of persecution to relive their harrowing experiences in concentration camps. Kavanagh finds it difficult to remain professionally detached from such an emotive case and discovers that, after 50 years, witness testimony is not always reliable. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Frederick Treves, Warren Mitchell and Peter Firth.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina is assaulted, and is shocked by the reaction of the Aidensfield residents when suspicion falls on a local policeman - until the attacker strikes again. Nick Berry stars.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick investigates the sudden reappearance of a local man last seen seven years previously, who turns up out of the blue and claims to be suffering from amnesia. Meanwhile, Greengrass receives a strange proposal from a man who seems to have taken the plot of Hitchcock's Strangers on a Train a bit too seriously.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A woman's attempt to cool her husband's ardour has unexpected and tragic consequences, while Greengrass takes up an illegal new hobby - cockfighting. Comedy, starring Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: A captivating French countess claims to know Richard and obtains an invitation to dinner. Believing her to be wealthy, the servants encourage the match, but things are not quite as they seem.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.sub-title: The Swords of Wayland - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Robin's sword Albion falls into the hands of Morgwyn and her coven, who prepare to use it in a ceremony to invoke the forces of evil. Michael Praed and Rula Lenska star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is reunited with old friend Ariadne Oliver, who has been commissioned to stage a game of murder hunt at a summer fete in the grounds of Nasse House, the recently purchased home of wealthy financier Sir George Stubbs. However, the novelist's instincts tell her she's getting involved in something much darker - and she's proved right when the girl volunteering to play the part of the victim really does turn out to be dead. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Zoe Wanamaker, Sean Pertwee, Martin Jarvis, Sam Kelly, Sinead Cusack, Rosalind Ayres and Tom Ellis.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is reunited with sidekick Captain Hastings (Hugh Fraser), secretary Miss Lemon (Pauline Moran) and Inspector Japp (Philip Jackson) in a case that plunges him into the world of global espionage as the Second World War looms. The public are in panic after the shocking death of Russian grandmaster Ivan Savaranoff during a game of chess. Poirot must try to determine the good guys from the bad, as a complex plot by a gang of dangerous dissidents sees a host of international figures used like pawns. David Suchet stars in a story adapted by Mark Gatiss and Ian Hallard.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Stanhope and her team, including new recruit DC Hicham Cherradi, travel to a remote country house when the woman looking after it is killed. No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A fisherman's body is found tangled up in a North Sea trawler's net. Vera and her team investigate with the help of the local harbourmaster, and find the dead man's sons pointing the finger at the owner of a fish market, with whom they have a long-running feud. Retracing the dead man's steps, Vera discovers when he drowned and tracks down a waitress who may have been one of the last people to see him alive. However, the case becomes more complicated when a witness runs away and a boat belonging to the dead man's sister-in-law goes up in flames.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: A Little Bit of Heart - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for Xun Li, a missing devoted husband and father who has a successful property business, soon escalates into a kidnap and ransom case. However, with the perpetrators cleverly staying one step ahead of the police, it becomes clear that they are not dealing with average criminals. When it appears that the case is closed, Banks and the team are are faced with an unexpected turn of events. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe, Caroline Catz and Jack Deam.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: A Little Bit of Heart - Part Two.
programme.desc: The team is thrown when a recently rescued kidnap victim is found murdered, with evidence suggesting a local protection gang is to blame. However, apprehending the woman they suspect proves challenging, as witnesses know the price they will pay for talking to the police. Meanwhile, Banks discovers a long-buried secret. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Brief Encounters

Drama, starring Penelope Wilton, Sophie Rundle, Angela Griffin and Sharon Rooney.(n)

Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack, David Harewood and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.desc: The race is on to find a suitable donor to save a dying leukaemia patient. Drama, starring Haydn Gwynne, Gary Mavers and Adrian Lukis.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A Russian sailor claims political asylum when his ship docks in Whitby, while Greengrass finds an unlikely partner in crime.(n)

programme.desc: There is trouble in the village when local children get their hands on some wartime ammunition, while Greengrass locks horns with Lord Ashfordly's new gamekeeper and Kate realises she is pregnant.(n)

programme.desc: As the team see victory in their grasp, Fred has a heart attack. Cricketing drama, starring Josie Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: As the crime drama returns for its 13th and final series, Poirot finds himself investigating the strange and gruesome murder of an elderly psychiatrist. Elsewhere, the detective's old friend Ariadne Oliver is being pressed to uncover the truth behind two decade-old deaths. As the pair dig deep for evidence, they soon discover that their separate investigations are linked and join forces to solve the overarching mystery. David Suchet, Zoe Wanamaker and Greta Scacchi star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls victim to depression after failing to prevent the murder of a society girl by notorious art thief Marrascaud. His confidence shattered, Poirot eventually returns to work when a lonely chauffeur begs him to find his missing soulmate, the maid of a famous Russian dancer. The investigation takes him to the Swiss Alps, where, against all odds, he stumbles upon a hotel thought to be Marrascaud's hideout - leading to a very personal showdown. The penultimate episode of the long-running detective drama, starring David Suchet, with Simon Callow, Orla Brady, Patrick Ryecart, Nigel Lindsay, Morven Christie, Tom Austen and Rupert Evans.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When Hastings and a reluctant Poirot attend a grouse shoot at a friend's estate, one of the hunting party is murdered. Despite suffering a severe cold, the Belgian sleuth is roused from his sickbed to solve the case. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: Melbourne warns Victoria that Parliament will not be happy about her marrying a German prince, a prediction that proves all too accurate when the Privy Council refuse to grant Albert a royal title. The prince fears for his future in England, while Victoria succumbs to paranoia, becoming convinced that he only intends to marry her for the financial independence he will gain.(n)

programme.title: The Americans
programme.desc: A secret brings Elizabeth and Paige together, while Oleg comes under KGB suspicion in Moscow. A new twist in the Morozov operation creates an opportunity that changes everything.(n)

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: David and Robyn are woken in the early hours by the police and David immediately assumes the worst, thinking something has happened to one of the children. A visit to the doctor confirms Adam's suspicions about Pete, and an adrenaline-fuelled bike ride fails to take Pete's mind off the situation. A visit to see care patient Harry (James Bolam) adds to Pete's woes when Harry makes a morose request and, in a bid to escape the pressures at home, Jenny's moment of madness at work comes back to haunt her.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Charles Jantzen saves 37 dogs from a fire, and rescue technician Roman Leal searches a drain for some stranded puppies.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators seize three starving horses, and kittens need rescuing from an attic.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How toxicologists search for hidden clues in blood and tissue to bring murders to light, including the case of a wife poisoned by cyanide.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How a drug-dependent landlady killed and buried seven victims for their social security cheques. Plus, a serial murderer is convicted on the basis of DNA evidence, 12 years after committing the crime.(n)

programme.title: Grave Secrets
programme.desc: The 1995 case of Wendy Kratzert, whose van initially appeared to have skidded off the road. On closer inspection, police ruled out misadventure as the cause of her death.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The hunt for 18-year-old Kelsey Smith, who disappeared from a Kansas Mall in June 2007. The only clue detectives had was the haunting final images of her on surveillance video. The case turned into a murder investigation when Kelsey's body was recovered from a lake in Missouri a month later.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A case in which a house erupted in flames, killing one person and injuring another. The survivor blamed a kerosene heater; the evidence at the scene did not support her story, and she was charged with arson and murder. Later, a renowned fire inspector checked the evidence and discovered the real culprit.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A cold case from 1957, in which a man committed several crimes in one night - including murder. California police followed numerous leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators made a breakthrough.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How modern investigation techniques coupled with broken shards from a car headlight helped in the case of a hit-and-run death of a Michigan cyclist, leading officers to both the vehicle and its driver.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Examining evidence to determine how a fire broke out in the home of an elderly couple and whether their son was to blame, despite his pleas of innocence.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An insight into how the latest techniques helped to find the murderer of a mother-of-two whose body was found 20 years earlier.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The discovery and identification of a human skull found in a Texas canyon with a single red hair, which led police to launch a manhunt when it was reconstructed.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the disappearance of a woman in Key West, Florida, that yielded nothing but a pair of sandals which may have belonged to her. Then two important pieces of video surfaced, and police began to wonder if they should be searching for a missing person or a killer.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The case of a mother-of-two and army wife found dead in her bedroom. There were messages left near her body, and a gun in her hand. Her death was initially ruled a suicide, until investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier and decided to take another look at the evidence to deduce whether murder was a possibility.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Officers find themselves having to reassemble a computer disk cut up with pinking shears in order to solve a brutal murder case.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Tiny pieces of plastic - the size of grains of sand - provide police with clues after a bombing in which a man was killed.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The death of an Air Force Officer's wife appears to be a tragic accident, but closer inspection of the scene reveals more sinister circumstances.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A highway patrolman is dispatched to a seemingly routine traffic accident, but his suspicions are aroused when he sees the amount of blood in the car.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the police recover a submerged car belonging to a man reported missing, they are perturbed to discover a pair of broken glasses on the floor but no body.(n)
