programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton comes to the aid of a couple from Yorkshire who are searching for a large property for holidays with members of their extended family in the north of Tenerife, working with a budget of £360,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Shelley and David Warner in their search for a property in Daytona, Florida, and shows them what they can get for their £230,000 budget. The Essex couple have high hopes as house prices in the sunshine state have fallen in recent times.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps retired couple Paul and Lindy, from the Midlands, search for a suitable property on the Costa del Azahar in Spain.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: In Grasmere, chef Kevin Tickle goes foraging to cook some local dishes at his Forest Side restaurant, and in Wensleydale, gamekeeper David Hutchinson readies the estate for a shoot.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Taxi driver Nik Christides hosts the first party in east Hampshire, where one guest causes a stir by revealing details of a romantic encounter with Boyzone singer Ronan Keating. Later, Nik introduces his diners to the sport of Cheesy Darts, which requires one guest to smear their face with cream, before having cheese-flavoured crisps thrown at them.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-four Jax Naudi hosts the second dinner party in east Hampshire, but her theme for the evening causes confusion and leads to one guest wearing an inappropriate outfit. Although Sue Hood expresses her distaste for the host's menu by remaining silent throughout the meal, the mood improves when Jax reveals the evening's entertainment - life drawing with a nude model.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Natalie Edemska-Plant hosts the third dinner party in east Hampshire, and plans to serve dishes from her childhood to give her guests an authentic Russian dining experience. She begins the evening with traditional customs such as banning shoes inside the house, and although her food is not a complete success, the night ends on a high note with some energetic dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: History fanatic Kyle Curtis hosts the fourth dinner party from east Hampshire. A self-confessed novice in the kitchen, he decides to get his guests to help him with his main course - a fish fondue - and his choice of dress code for the evening proves a hit.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sue Hood hosts the final night of the culinary competition in east Hampshire, hoping to impress her guests with a Caribbean-themed dinner party. The evening kicks off with the diners taking turns hitting a pinata, followed by entertainment in the form of dancers before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit is to the 12th-century Oxenham Arms, Devon, where owners Simon and Lyn Powell hope to kick-off the competition in style. The guests participate in broom dancing and after throwing some moves, the hosts have fellow contestant John pegged as the one to watch.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Elegant House bed and breakfast in Liverpool on their second night, where host John Brady hopes his unique property will stand out from the crowd. Nikki and David get to grips with the unconventional facilities, and David reveals his background as a hotel inspector - with Amanda making her opinions on the star rating system very clear.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Monmouthshire, where Peter and Amanda Copp want to rope their guests into the world of `glamping' at Hidden Valley Yurts. John has a hairy encounter in his yurt, and the shared bathroom facilities fail to impress David and Nikki. The next morning, the DIY breakfast proves underwhelming for some, while the hosts discover that the great outdoors is not everyone's cup of tea.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Former hotel inspector and owner David Stanbridge and manager Nikki Deans welcome the contestants to the Cley Hall Hotel in Spalding, Lincolnshire. Peter and Amanda are impressed by their room, but Simon and Lyn are unhappy with the state of the carpet. The next morning, the guests decide to put their eight-minute breakfast rule to the test, and some of them have concerns about Nikki's waitressing skills.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts meet for the final time to find out what they've been paid and confront their critics. Simon and Lyn kick off proceedings by demanding answers from John about his disturbed night's sleep, but then find themselves taken to task by David over their cleanliness feedback. However, the former hotel inspector receives his own interrogation from Peter and Amanda, who want to know why he didn't praise their shared bathroom facilities. Tensions run high as the payments are revealed and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Penelope Keith at Her Majesty's Service
programme.desc: The actress travels around the country to visit the Queen's official residences and meet people with royal appointments. The journey begins in Windsor Castle, where she finds out about Britain's oldest order of chivalry, meets the Royal Herb Strewer and unearths a box of treasure dating back to Elizabeth I. She also takes a trip up the Thames in the gilded barge Gloriana.(n)

programme.title: The Royal House of Windsor
programme.desc: This episode reveals how Prince Philip was the Windsors' most radical moderniser, and explores how he compensated for his emasculated status in one of the most daring experiments in modernisation attempted by the Windsors. The focus also falls on the formidable opposition that the young Queen Elizabeth II faced during her early years in the throne, as influential figures opposed her bearing her husband's family name, Mountbatten.(n)

programme.title: The Queen's Coronation: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the conflict between the Queen Mother and Prince Philip over how to administer Princess Elizabeth's coronation in 1953. While the public was presented with an image of the Windsors as a firmly united family, the pair clashed over Philip's desire to introduce the population to a monarchy ready to adapt to modern times. This programme charts the Queen Mother's efforts to protect the royal reputation she helped rebuild after the abdication of Edward VIII.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: The stars of 8 Out of 10 Cats take on the long-running quiz for a second time, as Sean Lock faces Jon Richardson in a rematch of their original encounter on the pilot show. Jimmy Carr hosts proceedings, while maths whizz Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers, with a little help from comedian Joe Wilkinson. David O'Doherty and Susie Dent are in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the quiz, as 8 Out of 10 Cats team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by Jason Manford and Rhod Gilbert. Countdown regular Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner with actor Danny Dyer, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers with a little help from comedian Joe Wilkinson.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.sub-title: Kicking Bishop Brennan Up the A***.
programme.desc: Cheating in the football match backfires on Ted, prompting his Rugged Island rivals to think up a devilish forfeit - and leaving the priest trying to contrive a way of kicking Bishop Brennan's backside and getting away with it. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan and Ardal O'Hanlon.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Mrs Doyle wins a competition to meet a famous singer, and discreetly invites him round for tea - but the secret slips out, and soon the house is besieged by hordes of adoring pensioners. Comedy, starring Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon and Pauline McLynn.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: The stars of 8 Out of 10 Cats take on the long-running quiz for a second time, as Sean Lock faces Jon Richardson in a rematch of their original encounter on the pilot show. Jimmy Carr hosts proceedings, while maths whizz Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers, with a little help from comedian Joe Wilkinson. David O'Doherty and Susie Dent are in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Gok Wan, Sarah Millican, Seann Walsh and Amy Childs join team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock on the irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr. The contestants answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search for properties in south and east London. Sisters Ruth and Anna are pooling funds, while Aba, also a first-time buyer, confesses to champagne tastes, but lemonade money.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Bath, Kirstie Allsopp meets first time buyers Laura and Phil, who are desperate to make the move from shared living to a home of their own. Meanwhile, Phil Spencer goes property searching with downsizing duo Kerrie and Dave, who sold their beloved barn conversion to move closer to their kids.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps Jacinta and Marco, who have outgrown their home in Didsbury, Greater Manchester, while Phil Spencer assists newly engaged Olivia and Amy, who want to settle back in the North after five years on the move.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five amateur chefs compete for the £1,000 prize in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and keen basketball player Ken Oputa is the first to host, inviting his guests to turn up in sportswear fancy dress. He hopes his Double Dribble mushrooms and Slam Dunk salmon will prove to be winning ingredients.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Interior designer Erika Sager hosts the second dinner party of the week on board her boat in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and invites her guests to dress up as pirates. Despite the unconventional setting, her rivals are all impressed by the standard of her food and hospitality.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-two Sarah Brice hosts the third dinner party in Kingston upon Thames, hoping to impress her guests with her own take on dishes including prawns, lamb and chocolate mousse. Ken Oputa tries to make an impression on the female contestants with his romantic poetry, but finds Erika Sager switches her attentions to his rival Jamie Baker.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Photographer Jamie Baker hosts the fourth party in London, and his ambitious menu of langoustine and crab ravioli, herb crusted rack of lamb, and milloux of chocolate - combined with his choice of evening entertainment - go down well, until an unexpected turn of events scuppers his plans.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired golfer David Witcher hosts the final evening in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and hopes to impress with an American-themed menu, including Wyoming slow-cooked ribs and Louisiana seafood chowder. After dinner, he entertains his guests with a bucking bronco, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at stately home Anstey Hall in Cambridge, with father and son team John and Johnny de Bruyne. The fun starts with a character-revealing afternoon of goose-herding, before the participants dress to impress at a formal dinner. John recounts stories of royal connections - which fails to impress hotel managers Mark and Layla. In the morning, as they tuck in to a self-service breakfast, guest Tim decides that DIY doesn't work at Anstey Hall, but when he notes this on his feedback form, John and Johnny accuse him of game-playing.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to clothes-free Clover Spa and Hotel in Birmingham, where owner Tim Higgs hopes to convert his rivals to the joys of naturism. Judging with an extra critical eye are John and Jonny De Bruyne, who received negative feedback from Tim, and a thorough room inspection reveals a dusty porn DVD. Tim tries to encourage his nervous guests to take part in a naked spa experience, but John opts to watch television instead. When feedback is invited, Tim is delighted to discover Mark and Layla would stay again but shocked by the `porn film' discovery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the Angel Hotel in Coleford, Gloucestershire for the third day of the competition, where a treasure hunt organised by hosts Mark and Layla brings out their guests' competitive sides. Meanwhile, there is confusion at breakfast and Layla's manners are criticised.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Higher Gitcombe in Totnes, Devon, where owners Paul and Lynnie Jolly set out to spoil their guests. Everyone is overwhelmed by the added extras, but naturist Tim is put off by cushions and clutter. After a masterclass in Nordic walking, Lynnie serves up a veg smoothie, which unhealthy eaters Mark and Layla dubiously down in one. Over dinner, Tim challenges his host's organic 'niche'. And Layla, still smarting from his negative feedback, labels him 'weird, naked Tim'. At breakfast, guests are wary as Tim's order goes wrong and Jonny and Layla engage in an eating competition. When feedback is invited, the Jollys are affronted by accusations of special treatment and vow to put the record straight.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the final day of the competition, the owners of Anstey Hall, the Clover Spa and Hotel, the Angel Hotel and Higher Gitcombe meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Having aired their issues, the winners are announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Ray Dodd hosts the first dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but finds his guests a difficult crowd to please. Recruitment executive Michelle Watson turns her nose up at the salmon starter, while choir director Joseph Benneh sends his steak back to the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment executive Michelle Watson welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but the previous night's host Ray Dodd is hungry for revenge following stinging criticism of his efforts. Michelle's cooking also fails to impress Joseph Benneh, so her hopes of scooping the week's prize rest with her choice of entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stuart Henson hosts a safari-themed dinner party on the third night in Milton Keynes. He hopes his exotic menu of zebra steak and `elephant dung surprise' will please his guests, but after the insults of the previous night he faces a difficult challenge to persuade his fellow diners to get along.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Choir director Joseph Benneh hosts the fourth dinner party in Milton Keynes, hoping the flavours from his homeland Ghana and a vocal masterclass will prove a winning combination. The guests' expectations are high, so he is under pressure to hit the spot with a menu that includes chicken liver pate, and groundnut soup with coconut rice.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Country enthusiast Susan Rogers hosts the final dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, hoping her French cuisine will win her extra points. She also demonstrates her skills with an accordion and gives her guests an origami masterclass, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Cameras follow animals at Chester Zoo, including Pedro the giant anteater. He is about to be reunited with his long-term partner, Bliss, but then he falls ill and faces a major operation, with an uncertain outcome. The zoo's extremely rare bald ibises produce a batch of new chicks, who are destined to be released back into the wild in southern Spain. There's also a chance to witness the reunion of rhino couple Beni and Asha, who have been kept separate for four years.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates a look back at the decade's TV shows, meeting people who appeared in them, those who watched them and their creators. The first of two programmes focuses on pleasure and leisure on 1970s television, with featured clips including outrageous adult jokes in pre-watershed sitcoms, smoking cigarettes on prime-time panel shows, a surprising history lesson aimed at children, and St Bernard dogs being offered for prizes. The footage is also seen through the eyes of people who missed the decade altogether and who find the moral values exhibited to be a real eye-opener.(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Mommy Nearest. Now that his mom Vy (Vernee Watson-Johnson) has broken up with her boyfriend, Will (Will Smith) accepts her invitiation to come back to Philadelphia for a family reunion. But he is less obliging--in fact he's downright appalled--when Vy begs him to remain in Philly after he graduates from prep school, rather than return to Bel-Air and begin college. Another of the series' trademarked surrealistic nightmares caps this episode. Robert Torti takes over from Diedrich Bader in the role of Will's caucasian Uncle Frank(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Winner Takes Off. Having targeted Geoffrey (Joseph Marcell) as a perfect patsy, Will (Will Smith) and Carlton (Alfonso Ribeiro) pull a series of rather nasty practical jokes on the beleagured butler, topping themselves by convincing Geoffrey that he's won a million-dollar lottery. The joke, alas, backfires when Geoffrey, convinced he's independently wealthy, quits his job--but not before telling the Banks family what he REALLY thinks of them, Ultimately, the truth comes out, and the humiliated Geoffrey accepts a restaurant job rather than return to the Bankses--and it's up to Will and Carlton to sheepishly set things right(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.sub-title: Hannah's Killer - Nowhere to Hide: Real Crime.
programme.desc: The five-and-a-half-year investigation into the rape and murder of Southampton teenager Hannah Foster in 2003. After fleeing the country, Maninder Pal Singh Kohli confessed to the crime live on Indian TV, and despite a retraction and efforts to stop himself facing justice in the British courts, in 2008 he became the first Indian national to be extradited back to the UK. Featuring interviews, archive footage and dramatic reconstruction.(n)

While he is pondering what to do, events take a further turn for the worse, and moving soon becomes the least of his worries. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst, Michelle Holmes and Dervla Kirwan.(n)

programme.desc: Dr Savage treats a recently released prisoner who has previously struggled with depression, while Dr Opong sees a patient who is terrified that, like his mother, he might have cancer. programme.title: The Coroner

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigates the shooting of a murder suspect, and there is no shortage of potential culprits, with his angry wife and vengeful brother high on the list. There's just one little puzzle to solve before the cops can even think about whodunit - at the time of the killing, the victim was in police custody, behind three locked doors guarded by Dwayne and JP. So how did the shooter manage to slip through undetected? As if that wasn't enough for Humphrey to worry about, he also has an unexpected visit from his father (guest star James Fox), with whom he doesn't exactly see eye to eye. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Story of Ireland
programme.desc: Fergal Keane explores Ireland's cultural, economic and social history, documenting its role on the international stage. He begins by revisiting the origins of the Celtic people, detailing the impact of Christianity and monasticism, the emergence of early literature, and the formation of law tracts that provide an insight into the day-to-day life of people nearly 1,500 years ago.(n)

programme.desc: The tourists take a cruise around Halong Bay, where they catch a glimpse of the endangered Langur monkeys. The party then flies south to to Ho Chi Minh City. They visit the sobering War Remnants Museum before exploring the city at night on vespas, where they go in search of local street food and try to keep up with the city's seven and a half million motorbikes.(n)

programme.title: Living the Wildlife
programme.desc: Camerman Colin Stafford-Johnson goes in search of the great crested grebe, a bird with extravagant plumage. As the birds nest alongside rivers with thick reeds, they can be tricky to spot, so he dons a pair of waders and keeps an eye out for the elusive animal. Next, he looks for otters in Co Kerry, which proves difficult after a swollen river has washed away their tracks.(n)

programme.title: The Sting

Oscar-winning Depression-era comedy drama, starring Robert Redford, Paul Newman, Robert Shaw, Charles Durning and Eileen Brennan. Includes Weather.(n)

He also discovers how Anne Boleyn's nieces died at Offaly's Clonony Castle, makes poitin on Lough Derg, and gains an insight into the lives of people who live and work on the river.(n)

Concorde took to the skies for the first time, while Jack Lynch won the general election and the Dublin Housing Action Committee led a campaign against homelessness.(n)

programme.desc: Gary faces up to the prospect of fatherhood in two eras 55 years apart, as the mothers of his children continually nag him about his responsibilities - and make demands on his bank balance. Emma Amos and Elizabeth Carling take over the roles of Yvonne and Phoebe respectively.(n)

programme.title: Nationwide
programme.desc: News stories from around the country, covering the latest topical issues.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Mo and Adele join their relatives for their sister's wedding, with Jesse and Mr Thompson escorting the medics to the ceremony - although before the day is out, a huge family secret is let slip, leading to heartache for at least one of the guests. Guy's world is rocked by the arrival of a familiar patient, although with help from the team on Keller, it allows him to finally come to terms with Zosia and her mental illness.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Nikki is not quite ready to let her family go, prompting Dixie to selflessly jump into the fray to save them from her wrath. However, her actions have a bittersweet outcome. Charlie suggests Cal should turn to genetic testing to solve his dilemma, but with Ethan racked with guilt over missing Olivia's signs of abuse, Cal decides breaking the news to his troubled brother might make things worse. Meanwhile, Lofty fails to impress Rita as he campaigns for promotion and feels he has let himself down. Medical drama, starring Jane Hazlegrove.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A man is murdered at the unveiling of a new church clock and the cleric must act quickly before an innocent woman is sent to the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Service
programme.desc: Rev Alan Mitchell leads a service with a congregation and choir drawn from the 1st Monaghan and Smithborough Presbyterian churches in Co Monaghan.(n)

programme.title: Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Winter draws to a close and the first signs of spring appear. The animals living along Alaska's inhospitable shoreline must make the most of the brief period of sunshine while it lasts.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News: One O'Clock and Farming Weather
Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville organises a cut-price sale - but only as a means to get rid of old stock - while Nurse Gladys is reunited with a former patient. Romance is in the air in the neighbourhood, as Mrs Featherstone has her eye on a new arrival while Mavis tries to reignite Granville's passion over a cup of coffee.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: One of Del's old flames turns up out of the blue, so Rodney and Grandad resolve to extinguish any passion that might still be smouldering in the Peckham wide boy's heart. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Zorro
programme.desc: The masked hero investigates a mysterious explosion linked to a French count, who is plotting to prevent California joining the United States - and discovers his wife, who walked out on their marriage when he refused to hang up his sword, is somehow involved. Swashbuckling adventure sequel, starring Antonio Banderas, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Rufus Sewell, Alberto Reyes and Adrian Alonso.(n)

programme.title: Nuacht
programme.desc: The latest news headlines.(n)

programme.title: How to Cook Well with Rory O'Connell
programme.desc: Cookery teacher Rory O'Connell prepares risotto alla Parmigiana, followed by a warm salad of quail with grapes, honey and bacon. Then, for dessert, he demonstrates how to make candied citrus zests.(n)

programme.title: Stetsons and Stilettos
programme.desc: A look at the world of Irish country music and its fans, beginning with a report from the Cowboys and Heroes festival, where an area of rural Ireland is transformed into the Wild West for one weekend.(n)

programme.title: Creedon's Shannon
programme.desc: John Creedon continues his journey to the mouth of the Shannon. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Lords and Ladles
programme.desc: Chefs Derry Clarke, Catherine Fulvio and Paul Flynn present a guide to historical cooking. In the first episode, they visit Birr Castle in County Offaly, which is home to the Earl of Rosse, and make a meal using recipes drawn from a handwritten 17th-century cookbook, including a potato pie first prepared in 1666.(n)

programme.title: Francis Brennan's Grand Tour
programme.sub-title: Francis Brennan's Grand Vietnamese Tour: Ho Chi Minh City.
programme.desc: Francis wakes his party up early for coffee in the park before moving on to the Independence Palace. They meet Dublin-born children's rights campaigner Christina Noble> They move on to the Cao Dai Temple and the famous Cu Chi Tunnels, which proved instrumental in the outcome of the Vietnam War and present a daunting prospect to modern visitors due to torrential rain and resident bats.(n)

Comedy, directed by and starring Woody Allen. With Penelope Cruz, Alec Baldwin, Ellen Page and Jesse Eisenberg.(n)

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: The sheep discover a mysterious buzzing object in their field - so Shaun investigates and finds it is full of bees.(n)

programme.title: Man with a Plan
programme.desc: Adam gets fed up with endless demands from his daughter's teacher, Mrs Rodriguez, and makes a hasty decision that gets him in trouble with Andi.(n)

programme.title: Man with a Plan
programme.desc: At Don's urging, Adam cleans out his cluttered garage and turns it into a man cave, but panics when he thinks he has given away one of Andi's treasured keepsakes.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are in Russia as the motoring magazine returns, taking part in a race across the urban landscape of St Petersburg. James defends the honour of the car in a very small Renault, Richard tries to prove that pedalling is faster by riding a bicycle, while Jeremy attempts to demonstrate that water is the quickest way across town by piloting a hovercraft. To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. Plus, the new Lamborghini Huracan is put through its paces and singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran takes to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Timeless
programme.desc: Rufus discovers the Mothership has landed in Nevada on 21 September, 1962, where it seems Flynn is blackmailing John F Kennedy's mistress into helping him steal an atomic bomb.(n)

programme.desc: Dublin v Wexford and Galway v Tipperary (Throw-ins 5.00pm and 7.00pm). programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.desc: A family holiday ends in a serious road accident, but paramedic Darren Axe has to hitch a lift to the scene in a passing car when the chopper is grounded by fog. Presented by Rav Wilding.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Basildon.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Basildon, Essex, to meet nine-year-old Brandon, who suffers a severe form of epilepsy and can have up to 30 seizures a day. He requires 24-hour care and mum Jenny can't let him out of her sight for a moment - and to make matters worse, the family home simply isn't safe enough for the youngster. Luckily, the local tradesmen have heard of the family's plight and arrive in force to help Nick and the team transform the home, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they don't stray too far from her vision.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999

programme.title: Countryside 999

Plus, Tom and Craig visit a former student still waiting to receive £34,000 from a Chinese education centre, and Pete tries to recoup the money a garage customer spent on a vehicle that turned out to be faulty. Narrated by David Reed.(n)

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, featuring a hard-hitting mixture of bodycam and observational footage, which reflect the daily challenges of combating crime and offer fresh insights into the fast-paced world of modern policing.(n)

programme.title: My Small Breasts and I
programme.desc: Profiles of three women whose lives are dominated by the belief that their breasts are too small. Sharon, Laura and Kate all feel hatred toward their own bodies, prompted by their A cup breasts - a self-loathing they try to combat through suctioning, herbal pills and phototherapy.(n)

programme.title: My Tattoo Addiction
programme.desc: The documentary hears from people whose love of body art has had a profound effect on the way they conduct their lives. Mark's many photo-realistic tattoos challenge accepted notions of taste, and Deke talks about his attempts to conceal one particular image from his girlfriend's parents. In Magaluf, reveller Liam tries to persuade other holiday-makers to brand themselves with his `burger nipple' design, while Joanne's tattoo of an ex-wife's name is a painful reminder of her previous life as a man.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. Among his destinations are a 1930s banking building that has remained unaltered since closing in 2007, a well-appointed set of toilets and a recording studio hidden in a bar. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming discovers more little-known facts on a journey between Smithfields and Spitalfields, two of London's most famous markets. He begins with a fry-up breakfast before visiting the remains of a Roman amphitheatre and investigating a mysterious secret in a Liverpool Street hotel, as well as meeting former EastEnders star Larry Lamb (Archie Mitchell).(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores Newcastle, discovering strange sounds by the river and finding out how traditional culture is being reinterpreted in the Byker district. He goes behind the scenes at Newcastle United with local football hero Peter Beardsley, learns about the history of adult comic Viz from former editor Simon Donald and accompanies comedienne Sarah Millican to her favourite part of the city.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How the Norman Conquest in 1066 transformed Britain, as William the Conqueror sought to assert his power over the whole of England by dismantling the Anglo-Saxon aristocracy and crushing regional diversity. The programme explores the human cost of his campaign and the lasting legacy of the social structures established by the Normans, and explains how a spirit of resistance began to foment among the population. Dramatic reconstructions also reveal how the longbow was instrumental in Henry V's famous victory at the battle of Agincourt in 1415. With contributions by Tim Roth, Jeremy Irons, Micky Flanagan and Tracey Emin.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The Putin Interviews
programme.desc: Russian president Vladimir Putin speaks to Oscar-winning writer and director Oliver Stone in an unprecedented series of interviews.(n)

programme.title: San Francisco 2.0
programme.desc: American documentary filmmaker Alexandra Pelosi explores how the digital gold rush has affected the progressive nature of her hometown of San Francisco, which is long regarded as the US capital of counterculture.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: While examining a man with a severely enlarged tongue, House is shot by the husband of a former patient who holds the doctor responsible for his wife's suicide. As the injured medic instructs the team to find the cause of his patient's swelling, he realises his own pain has disappeared - but the operation to remove the bullet appears to have affected his mind as well as his nerves. Guest starring Elias Koteas.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The medic's staff find two challenging cases for him to investigate on his return to work and are surprised at the apparent change in his usual attitude to his patients. House decides to take both cases on simultaneously and infuriates his staff with his willingness to explore unlikely solutions. Hugh Laurie and Jesse Spencer star.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A boy is found unconscious on his front lawn. The hospital staff are divided over his claim he was abducted by aliens, with House refusing to accept an extraterrestrial explanation for the youngster's predicament. Struggling to find a solution to the patient's blood-clotting problem and hallucinations, the doctor's depression becomes increasingly acute. Medical drama, guest starring Sheryl Lee (Dirty Sexy Money).(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: When Martin's terminally ill aunt disappears, the team's investigation reveals she has been helping hospital patients commit suicide. Meanwhile, Jack attempts a reconciliation with his father, who has been diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease. Guest starring Martin Landau (Ed Wood).(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A man disappears while trying to prove the innocence of his son - a death row inmate awaiting execution for murdering a married couple in front of their daughter during a botched robbery.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Jack and the team investigate the disappearance of a college football coach who has recently been fired because of his team's dismal performance. Angry players, the college administration and a gambler all come under suspicion in the mysterious case. With Anthony LaPaglia and Poppy Montgomery.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A teenager approaches the team and asks for their help, claiming she was kidnapped as a child. Meanwhile, Jack considers returning to Chicago. Crime drama, starring Anthony LaPaglia.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: The American soldiers arrive in Melbourne following their ordeal at Guadalcanal, and are greeted as heroes by the Australian public. Leckie falls for a local woman, and Basilone is honoured for his bravery in battle - but discovers that his new-found fame back home has an unexpected downside. Second World War drama, starring James Badge Dale and Jon Seda.(n)

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: Leckie and his comrades arrive on the island of New Britain, where they try to repel a concerted Japanese attack - but adjusting to the jungle terrain and battling illness prove to be their greatest challenges. After clashing with his commanding officer, Leckie witnesses a horrifying sight, and soon finds himself struggling to retain his sanity. Second World War drama, based on the memoirs of US marines, starring James Badge Dale.(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Spencer pitches expansion in Vegas, Ricky rolls the dice, and Vernon makes a risky endorsement deal.(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
programme.desc: American talk show in which British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver presents a satirical look at the biggest news stories, political developments and pop culture events of the previous seven days. The topical series sees the former Daily Show reporter offer his distinct take on a variety of social, political and existential issues facing society.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Mickey pushes his luck by throwing himself a goodbye party. Liev Schreiber and Jon Voight star.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan

programme.title: Twin Peaks: The Return

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Pat Seddon considers selling up and visits a clairvoyant, while celebrity chef Mitch Tonks makes an appearance at Brixham's Crab Festival.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Maritime Inn landlady Pat gets her first full house of the season as Brixham's tourist trade picks up for the summer - but refuses to hire anyone to help her with the extra work. Powerboat instructor Mike Weatherbee tries to enforce the laws of the sea, carpet-cleaner Dave Satchwill prepares to lead the town's popular ghost tour, and lone fisherman Dave Brown reveals his unusual methods.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming heads across the Irish Sea to Dublin, where he succumbs to the city's famous charm and meets some of its most fascinating characters. On a journey that takes in an 18th-century pleasure house and a burlesque life-painting class, Alan also stops off in Temple Bar for a pint with singer Sharon Corr, unlocks a mystery in Ireland's oldest library and uncovers a stylish secret that lurks behind the steel shutters of an old lock-up.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Glasgow, one of his favourite cities, to reveal unusual and often hidden sights and sounds overlooked by the public. Starting at the Necropolis, he travels to the world's oldest music hall before enjoying the views from a city-centre landmark. He also finds the time to take tea with a film star.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britain's grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: Dinosaur 13
programme.desc: In 1990, paleontologist Peter Larson and his team from the Black Hills Institute made one of history's greatest dinosaur discoveries; the largest and most complete Tyrannosaurus Rex fossil ever found. The documentary details the true story behind the discovery, as well as the struggle that surrounded it, including a 10-year battle with the US government, museums, Native American tribes and competing paleontologists.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny enters New York's Hasidic community to investigate the murder of the man recently appointed its leader - only to find the victim led a complicated personal life. programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When a 10-year-old boy is shot on a New York housing estate, Danny's heated approach to the case lands him in anger-management classes. Meanwhile, Frank has to deal with the State Department and the Turkish government to help a woman avoid persecution and Erin begrudgingly agrees to let Jamie teach Nicky how to drive. Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg star.(n)
